Frank nodded and got a little closer to his companion. Up ahead was a round silver building with a large sign on top. Rob noticed it first and gleefully pointed it out to Frank. "Oh man, there the diner is up ahead! I'm starving!" Frank was still upset at Rob for abandoning the food backpack, but if this diner had half of what had been in the backpack they left that would soon change. As they got closer Frank noticed another building on the other side of the street. It was the two-story motel that Rob had mentioned. "Hey Rob! There's the motel!" He called to make sure Rob knew about it. "Yeah yeah, I see it." He replied. "Now, we have two things we need to do: Clear any and all zombies out of the motel so we can sleep there and gather supplies at the diner. I'll let you choose which job you want to do. What'll it be?"
1233111112.title: No time to rest!

choices: Frank decides to close the door and run
Frank asks what they are doing here
12331111122.content:
"Alright, look at you, stepping up to do some zombie killing!" Rob said cheerfully as began walking towards the diner. "Here's another spare clip, you'll need it. Be careful..." Frank caught the clip and put it into his pants pocket where he'd have easy access to it. "Okay, Frank... You can do this..." He mumbled to himself as he looked over the motel. "Well, its not what I would call 5 stars, but it'll have to do." Frank slowly made his way closer and kept listening for any movement as he stepped into the parking lot. Funnily enough, he could hear something that sounded like music coming from somewhere on the upper level. Frank shook his head and tried listening again. The music was still there, something about a boogie man killing people or something. "Great, I'm not going insane, but who the hell would be playing music at a time like this?" Frank rubbed his forehead and began walking through the parking lot. "Guess I'll find out..."


Frank was so concerned about the music that he almost missed the limbless zombie sitting propped up against a rusty old car. It's belly was carved open and its guts were spread out around it. There was no threat, but it caught Frank completely off guard. "Jesus!" He gasped as the thing began twisting around, trying to get closer and kill him. Frank bent over a nearby truck and threw up a little on the hood. "Oh god... how is that thing still moving?" He tried aiming his gun at it as it gargled and spat blood, yet couldn't bring himself to pull the trigger. After a minute of nausea he decided to just leave it be and ran over to the short hallway that led to the stairs at the back of the motel. Frank wiped the sweat off of his face with his sleeve and tried taking a few deep breaths. Once he had calmed himself a bit it continued on to the top floor.


Frank grabbed ahold of the metal railing as he stepped onto the upper floor to steady himself. The sight of that mutilated zombie had proved to be quite a distraction... so much so that he had forgotten all about the music he had been hearing until now. A new song began and Frank listened once again. The music was coming from a room further down the hallway. "This is crazy..." Frank said as he climbed over part of a barbed wire fence someone had placed to block off the hallway. Just as he jumped down on the other side Frank ripped his pants and part of his leg on the annoying hazard. "Ah, son of a bitch!" He groaned as he rubbed his leg. "Whoever is up here has to be insane..."


As it turned out, Frank couldn't have been more right as he soon found out when he came to the room of the people playing the music. The only window was boarded up with "FUCK OFF ZOMBIES" written on it in bright red letters. The door was no better... as the evil-looking clown face on the front could attest. "What did I get myself into..." Frank whispered as he opened the door and was met with the full blast of the loud music playing. Of course, the music was nothing compared to the dozen or so people inside. Everyone was dressed in hoodies, coats, or otherwise going around shirtless, including one of the only two girls in the group who looked to be about 20 years old. The real kicker though, was the fact that every last one of them was decked out in clown face-paint. "Ugh sorry, wrong room...?" Frank squeaked as a large man got up off his beanbag chair and set his can of soda down on a table with a bong on it. "Well, look what we got here, Juggalo's and Juggalette's. A survivor..."
12331111122.title: Down with the clowns

choices: "So what do you plan on doing if you are rescued?"
"Would it be okay if me and one other person spent the night here?"
123311111222.content:
Frank was more then intimidated and began backing away slowly. "I'm sorry for disturbing you, look I'll just forget I saw you and be on my way..." He was just about to close the door back when the large man put his hands up defensively. "Whoa, hey man, sorry if we spooked you, if you wanna leave that's fine, we won't stop you. Although, we'd like if you stayed for a little bit, we got plenty of supplies to go around and you must be tired." Frank froze in place. Was the 6 foot tall man in front of him... inviting him in? "Well, I guess I could use a... rest..." Frank replied. "Cool man, cool. Hey Weed man scoot your ass over and give our guest a place to sit." The big man called as he pulled the door aside for Frank. "Yo, sure thing boss." A man with a headband said as he sat up on the two person couch next to the table.


"Wow, um, thank you..." Frank said nervously as he walked into the room. "Can I get you anything, sugar?" The topless woman said in a sweet voice as she got up off the floor. "Anything... at all...?" She finished in a seductive tone. "Yo Brandy, cut it out. Our man here just made it past god knows how many zombies to get here. I'm sure he'll want some refreshments more then anything else. What can I get you?" The man said as he turned to Frank. "A beer? Blunt? Faygo?" Frank paused for a moment. "Wait, what did you just call me?" The man began laughing. "Don't tell me you never heard of faygo... hey Stitches toss me a can of that shit!" A skinny man in the corner reached into a nearby cooler and pulled out a brightly colored can of soda. He tossed it to Frank and smiled. "That be a moon mist dog, drink up."


Not wanting to insult them Frank quickly pulled the tab off and took a big gulp as he sat down next to the guy call Weed man. It wasn't like any soda Frank had had before and was surprisingly good. "That's great... I didn't know what I was missing..." Frank said with a weak laugh. "Hey, chill man, relax. We ain't gonna hurt you. Oh, by the way my name is Moon Killa. Nice to meet you." The large man said as he returned to his spot near the table and grabbed his soda. "I'm... Frank, nice to meet you." Frank said as he took another sip of this moon mist stuff. "Welcome, Frank!" Shouted about half of the people in the room. "So Frank, my man..." Weed man said as he leaned over with a freshly rolled joint. "Want to take a trip wit me?" Frank felt a bead of sweat roll down his cheek. "Ah, no... thank you..." He said as he finished off his can of Faygo. "Aww, c'mon man. What could it hurt, the zombies will probably kill us anyway sooner or later." Weed man said as he lit it and took a deep puff. "Stop that Weed, the man said no so how about you get that away from him." Moon Killa said as he lit up a joint himself. Weed man let out a sigh, but did as he was told. "Yeah yeah boss, but he don't know what he's missing."


Frank sat alone for a few minutes while the rest of the group partied. Finally, he worked up the courage to start asking them questions. "So, Moon Killa, what are you guys going all the way out here instead of trying to escape?" Moon Killa took a long puff on his joint and chuckled. "Well, we figured the whole world's shot to hell anyway, so we all banded together and fortified this motel as best we could. If we're all gonna die we wanna go out partying for as long as we can. Even if we do make it out alive there's plenty of us who would have nowhere to go. We're gonna live the time we have left as a family and if it comes to it, die like a family. You're more then welcome to leave anytime you like, but we're all gonna stay here." Frank was surprised at the unity and loyalty these people showed one another. When he first saw them he thought for sure they'd be hostile to him... He took a few moments to think up his next question and asked...
123311111222.title: Wicked clowns?

choices: Rob explains what happened...
Rob passes out as soon as they get inside...
1233111112222.content:
Moon Killa grinned and tossed Frank a pillow. "Sure thing, anyone you know is welcome here so long as they ain't a zombie. Follow me and I'll show you your bed." He said as he got up and and walked over towards the bathroom. It was fairly small inside with only a bathtub, toilet, and sink, but it didn't really matter as Frank watched as Moon Killa disappeared into a large pitch-black hole in the wall. In few seconds the room beyond the hole was lit up with a light and Frank cold see that it was almost an exact copy of the room the duo just came from. "You knocked out the wall in the bathroom?" Frank asked as Moon Killa showed up to greet him as he walked in. "Oh yeah." Moon Killa replied with a proud smile. "Me and my boys boarded up the door and window in this room and made us a new entrance. See, this way if zombies attack while we're asleep they'll have to go through all of our homies in the other room to get to us. Plus..." He leaned in close to whisper in Frank's ear with a sly smile on his face. "We keep our weapons and supplies in the spare bathroom over there."


Frank looked around as his new friend grabbed a spare blanket from their storage room. There were 4 mattresses scattered over the floor along with a few sleeping bags, 3 of which had people sleeping in them. In the corner there was a pile of sheets and blankets with a few pairs of underwear and socks mixed in. Pillows of all sizes and types were strewn about everywhere and the wall was covered in graffiti and crude drawings. It seemed a little crowded with almost zero floor space, but damn if it didn't look comfortable. "Here you go!" Moon said with a big smile. "Since you and your buddy are guests we'll let you share one of the beds tonight, so feel free to crash anytime you like." Frank walked over and sat his pillow and blanket down on the mattress just below the boarded up window. "Thank you Moon Killa." Frank said as they walked back into the other room. "My friend should be showing up pretty soon, I'll head outside and wait for him." Moon walked over to the cooler and grabbed another Faygo, this time a 60/40, and tossed it to Frank. "Give that to your friend when he gets here, and be sure to grab one yourself anytime you're thirsty, we got plenty!" Frank caught the soda and picked up his AK-47 which he had sat by the door when he came in. "I will, thanks." And with that Frank closed the door and stepped outside.


He sat on the edge of the walkway with his feet dangling between the railing. A gentle breeze began blowing through the trees, causing them to rustle softly. Of course, it was almost impossible to hear them over the music booming inside. Frank kept his gun ready to fire should he notice any movements in the parking lot below as he looked towards the diner. After 5 minutes a single gunshot was heard in the distance along with the sound of a body falling to the pavement. Frank focused his full attention on direction it came from and soon saw Rob running like a mad man out from behind a tree next to a house. There were 3 level 2 zombies in hot pursuit behind him and from the look of terror on his face, more following further behind. Frank yelled out to him as he entered the parking lot and began sprinting towards the stairs. Frank fired his AK-47 just as they passed under him and killed two of the zombies, leaving one to chase rob up the stairs. Fortunately, Frank remembered the barb wired fence in the hallway and quickly made his way over over to it. Rob slowed down as he got closer to it and ducked just in time for Frank to open fire on the last zombie. The first few shots to its chest did nothing, but when it began taking bullets to the head it quickly succumbed and fell to the floor. Without saying a word Frank quickly helped Rob over the fence and they headed back inside the motel room where their new allies were waiting...
1233111112222.title: A place to stay

choices: Moon Killa brings out the heavy artillery
Moon Killa orders a retreat to the walkway while the snipers cover them
12331111122221.content:
"Jesus, Rob. What the hell happened out there?" Frank asked as he helped Rob over to a cushion on the floor. "It was one of them moaning bitches... I saw her in the diner and tried to shoot her, but I was too late. Before her body even hit the floor a mob of zombies began surrounding me... Most... most of them were level one and a few level two's, but there were a few others that I saw in the distance... Goddamn it... a whole mob of the bastards are gathering outside..." Rob gasped between pants. "Where's your shotgun?" Frank asked as some of the juggalos began tending to his wounds. "A Digger grabbed ahold of it as I ran down the street and pulled it underground..." Rob replied with a groan as disinfectant was sprayed on his bleeding left arm. "Don't worry, he'll live... but he's way too fucked up to be fighting right now." A juggalo in a hat said as he wrapped some bandages around Rob's arm. "Shit... I'm sorry man." Rob said while trying to grin. "I guess I fucked up..." Frank simply shook his head and headed over to the door where he was joined by several freshly armed juggalos. "Don't worry, you did what you could, now take a rest while me and our new friends clean up. Isn't that right Moon Killa?" The big man grinned and adjusted his grip on his aluminum baseball bat. "Bitches won't know what hit 'em." He said in a confident tone. "Now then, let's show these punk ass zombies what happens when you fuck with the hatchet!" The cheers and battle cries that ensued assured both Rob and Frank that they were in good hands.


Within minutes snipers armed with hunting rifles were set up along the upper walkway while Frank and the rest of the juggalos gathered in the parking lot to face the horde. The zombies were fairly thin at first with most of them being snipped from far away before they could get close. Then they grew thicker... and thicker... until even the people on the ground were beginning to fall back a bit incase they needed to retreat. Frank was on the last clip of his gun and, although he had been given a sledgehammer to act as a melee weapon, tried to only shoot when he had a clear shot. Moon Killa and several of his friends were crowded around the tightly pack cars so he also had to be careful not to accidentally shoot them. When his gun finally blasted its last bullet into the head of a level three zombie coming in from the side he grabbed the massive hammer strapped to his back and gave it a hefty swing. Frank was by no means a strong man, but what he did to the skull of the poor zombie caught on the receiving end of his attack was almost enough to make him sick.


The fighting continued for a few minutes without the humans giving much ground, but soon stronger specials began appearing, making the fighting much harder. "Shit, look the fuck out!" A man with a scythe tattoo on his chest yelled as he knocked a man in sunglasses away just in time for a blob of purple slime to splash over him. "Ugh, what in the high fuck IS this?!" He shouted in disgust. Unfortunately, he soon found out as a Pyro appeared from behind a car and gave him the worst hug of his life. "Charlie!" Some of the juggalos shouted as a small explosion sent blood and flesh spraying in all directions. The zombies had claimed their first victim. "Oh god, they got Charlie..." One juggalo moaned as the smoke cleared from the mangled corpse that had once been his friend. "Its hopeless, too many... there's too many...!" He screamed as he dropped his gun and took a few steps back towards a parked truck. No sooner had he touched the hood then a Stalker grabbed him by the neck and carried him off as bullets whizzed past it. "Son of a bitch, we're losing ground!" Another juggalo called as an eerie shadow surrounded him before he could notice it. Something grabbed ahold of him and was just about to carve open his chest when the confused man was saved by one of his allies that had been nearby. "Come on, keep fighting!" His savior called as he smashed the skull of the Nightmare and led the man to safety. "Thank god, I thought I was screwed..." The man said tearfully as he fired his handgun at a rapidly approaching level two. "No problem, just be more careful!" Frank called as he took a swing at another zombie.

The humans have managed to survive this far... now how with they turn the tide of this seemingly hopeless battle?
12331111122221.title: Here they come...

choices: Frank stays outside and continues fighting with Moon Killa
Frank goes inside with the others and tries to think up a plan
123311111222211.content:
"Fuck man, they're starting to push us back!" One of the younger members of the group shouted as he smacked a zombie across the face with a hockey stick. "At this rate, we're all FUCKED!" The zombie started getting back up only to have its head crushed against the front bumper of a nearby car. "Moon Killa!" The young man called as he began wrestling with another zombie. "You need to do something, we won't last much longer!" The juggalos fearless leader agreed, but didn't want to resort to his ace in the hole this early in the fight. "Not just yet, keep fighting ninjas! Just hold them for a few more minutes... we can do this!" The minutes might as well have been hours with the opponents they were up against. They managed to hold their remaining ground for less then a single minute before another of their number fell prey to the zombies, a shy juggalette named Samantha was caught off guard by a Vampire and got her neck ripped open before she could react. "Ah fuck it... we ain't got any choice..." Moon Killa said as another of his friends took a nasty hit to the arm, nearly severing it. "You guys up top! Get the turret and explosives, HURRY!!!" The snipers nodded and disappeared inside, leaving their allies on the ground without any covering fire.


The survivors struggled even harder for the brief time the snipers were gone, losing two more of their members, but still managed to hold their ground. Finally, just as it seemed they were about to be overrun the men returned with several boxes and a mobile turret. "Get that shit set up and start tossing bombs!" Moon Killa yelled as he helped Frank take down another level three zombie. As soon as the gun was set up it began firing a hail of bullets that shredded the incoming hordes as molotov cocktails and other explosives were prepared. The remaining survivors quickly began to fall back to the staircase while they had the chance and began sealing off the ground floor as soon as they were all up top. By then the turret had used up most of its ammo supply and its operator quickly abandoned it to help the others light up explosives. The undead were finally starting to thin out a bit and things began looking up. That was before 2 men in white robes appeared amongst the zombies. "Hey! HEY!" Frank shouted as he lit a molotov. "There are some more survivors down there!" Moon Killa quickly rushed over to Frank and looked where he was pointing. "Where?! Wh-" Then he saw them. Two men with long hair were standing amongst the zombies, each with a white robe and a sinister look on their faces.


"Juggalos, the brotherhood is here! Open fire on those bastards!" Moon Killa shouted as the two men began walking closer, passing harmlessly by any zombie in their way. "What?!" Frank shouted as a Juggalo got back on the turret and began shooting. "Why are you going to kill them?!" Moon Killa was just about to answer when the turret abruptly ceased firing and the juggalo manning it fell to the floor, dead with a large black Crystal shard sticking out of his forehead. "Told you I could hit him from this distance." One of the men said with a chuckle as his partner rolled his eyes. "Yeah yeah, just make sure you block any more bullets they shoot at us with those crystals of yours." The other man said as they resumed walking. "Oh... oh my god!" Frank gasped as soon as he caught a glimpse of the nearly foot long shard sticking out of the corpses head. "What... what did they do to him?!" Moon Killa quickly grabbed the molotov out of Frank's hand and lobbed it right at the two. He knew it wouldn't work, but he had to distract them while the others retreated inside. "Everyone, get inside NOW!!!" He screamed as the molotov shattered on a thick sheet of black crystals that extended from one of the duo's arms and burst into flame. "Well now, looks like their leader has noticed us brother..." The other said as his sibling quickly extinguished the burning fire by spreading the crystals around it. "Indeed, let's go meet him..."
123311111222211.title: Cocktail party

choices: Moon Killa goes down to investigate
Moon Killa waits to see what happens
1233111112222111.content:
Moon Killa got on the turret and blasted its last few bullets at the two men as carefully as he could. None of them missed their target, but neither did they pierce the duo's crystal shield. "Fuck, as long as that bastard has those crystals we can't touch 'em!" Moon Killa was about to lose hope as the remaining zombies roared while their masters drew ever closer. As he struggled to light and throw another molotov he felt a hand on his shoulder. "Shit, didn't I t-" He yelled as he turned around, only to cut himself off as he looked into Frank's eyes. "Its not over yet. I fought like hell just to get here, now we're gonna finish them off." Frank said with determination in his voice. Without a word, Moon Killa smiled and gave a slight nod. "Even if it kills us, we won't stop fighting." Frank finished as he lit a molotov and handed it to his alley. "You keep the zombies from getting to our friends." Moon Killa took it and threw it right below them, creating a wall of flame between the nearest car and the entrance to the top floor. "Don't worry homie, I'll keep those fuckers from getting our friends, but what are you gonna do?" He asked as he turned towards Frank and grabbed another molotov. "You said those guys are against us, right?" Frank asked as he climbed over the railing right above a parked semi. "What? Yeah, but they have powers, you can't-" Moon Killa was then cut off with a loud thump as Frank jumped onto the top of the truck, narrowly avoiding falling of the edge. "Jesus, I hope this works..." Frank said as he pulled the two molotovs he had kept in his pockets out and removed the rags. He quickly poured them out all over the roof of the truck while keeping an eye on the two brothers as they stood motionless on the street, waiting to see what Frank would do. "This is it." Frank said with finality as he flicked the lighter and tossed it in onto the roof of the truck as he got down on the front hood.


With a tremendious roar flames slowly began engulfing the truck. "Only got one shot at this." Frank said as he knocked a zombie that tried to grab him aside and shattered the driver side window. He climbed inside and turned the keys that were still in the trucks ignition, just as he had noticed when he first walked up. "What the hell is the bastard doing?" The younger man asked his twin brother as Frank hit the gas... and drove straight at them. Zombies were pushed aside or crushed into the ground as Frank drove the blazing truck right out of the parking lot. "FUCK! HE'S GOING TO HIT US!" The older brother yelled as he turned to flee, but it was too late. Frank clentched his teeth as he swirved the truck and sent it flying onto its side right as the younger brother raised a crystal barrier to protect himself. The truck collided with the both of them as it slid into the ditch and ceased moving. "Oh... oh my god! Frank! FRANK!" Moon Killa called as the smoke from the ruined truck rose slowly into the air. Nothing stirred, nothing moved except the smoldering corpses in the parking lot...
1233111112222111.title: Light 'em up!

choices: Try to get back to the motel stairs while avoiding the remaining zombies
Go around the motel and try to get inside from the back somehow
12331111122221112.content:
"Shit... what the fuck happened down there?!" Moon Killa yelled over the groans of the zombies below him. A few more seconds passed before the smoke from the truck started to clear, revealing the burning wreckage of the truck. "Frank?! FRANK! Can you hear me?! Are you still alive?!" A lone figured sturred behind the truck, but seemed to be slumped on the ground holding something. Moon killa doubted it was Frank, but how could those Brotherhood members have survived that? The silence was finally broken by the sound of glass breaking, which seemed to attract the attention of a few zombies. Soon another lone figure was climbing out of the truck and onto its side before hopping to the ground. Moon Killa couldn't see very well from this distance, but he knew his friend had made it out okay. "Don't worry, I'll make sure you get back here safe." He said as he headed inside to grab some supplies to help finish off the remaining undead gathered around the motel entrance.


Frank rubbed his bleeding forehead as he took a moment to rest. Okay, THAT was definately one of my stupider ideas." He choked as he stumbled away from the smoking wreckage. Just as he was about to retreat back to the motel he heard something behind him... it sounded like... crying. The sight that met Frank when he turned around filled him with shock and horror. There, surrounded by broken crystal shards were the 2 men in white robes. One was holding the other in his hands as tears streamed down his face. The younger brother had not survived Frank's surprise attack... but the older had. "No... NO! EZEKIEL! Brother! Answer me!" He screamed as he tried to shake the dead man awake. "Answer me brother!" It was no use. Ezekiel had taken the full force of the truck and his shield had shattered on impact as evidenced by the many shards jutting out from his body at various angles. While that may have been survivible by a member of the Brotherhood, a broken neck and crushed skull certainly were not.


Wasting no time Frank quickly began sprinting back to the motel before the surviving brother noticed him. He had no weapons and was pretty banged up, not to mention up against someone who could apparently somehow survive a full on burning truck collision. "My little brother... Ezekiel... I WILL AVENGE YOU!" The robed man screamed furiously as his dead sibling was slowly engulfed in a bright red light and crumbled apart, leaving behind only his own robe. "Fuck!" Frank muttered under his breath as he shoved aside a zombie that made a grab for him. "I have to get past over a dozen zombies to get back inside and that psychopath is right behind me!" Frank was in a tight spot, but had managed to survive so far... what can he do?
12331111122221112.title: Between a rock and a hard place

choices: An abandoned car
Franks house
12331112.content:
Frank grabbed M79 grenade launcher and plenty of grenades.

http://media.giantbomb.com/uploads/1/133...

He and Rob made their way out of the gun store. You both made your way into the center of Ruststone. After several minutes, you came across
12331112.title: Frank chooses the grenade launcher

1233112.content: Frank decided to check the supply room first, like there would be anything useful behind the counter anyway. He walked over and turned the knob, to his surprise the door wasn't locked. Unfortunately, another surprise was in store for him behind the door, this one much less pleasant. Standing behind the door was a man with a shotgun who didn't have time to ask questions, he would shoot first at anything that came in. Frank was hit immediately with two rounds to his upper torso and fell to the ground with a thud. The last thing he heard and saw as his heart stopped beating was a man standing over him with a bloodied t-shirt gasping: "Oh shit... OH SHIT...!"
1233112.title: Game over

123312.content: Frank was close, but knew he had no hope of getting to the store in time. He made a quick leap over the overturned wreak of a motorcycle and onto the hood of a windowless car. Sparing not a second Frank then leaped down onto the cold pavement again on the other side of the row of cars and ran towards the van. He made one final jump into the interior and slamed the door shut behind him. For a split second he thought he was safe, but was soon met with the fatal error in his judgement. To his absolute horror the door of the van slid back open just as the birds made their final descent. It was broken and couldn't be closed ever again. Frank screamed in fear and pain as the hellspawn pulled him from the vehicle as he flailed about wildly. He soon fired off the last two shots in his revolver, both misses. It would be only minutes before Frank passed out from shock... never to wake up again. By the time the sun finally appeared in the sky the next day all that remained of his body was a bloodied skeleton laying on the ground with an empty revolver still in its hand.
123312.title: Bird feed

choices: He finds the gift shop
A call comes in from his radio
Readers Choice
124.content:
Frank was barricaded in an abandoned passenger plane, sitting at one of the gates of the Bitterwood International Airport. He had an AKS-47 assult rifle in his hands.

132.content:
Betty was running late and had to get back to Pluto's, the Diner where she used to work to pick up her last paycheque. It was raining hard as she left her

house not far from the airport. There was an odd smell in the night air as she hurried to her previous work place. The streets were coming alive with

zombies who were looking for their next victim. She did not feel like being someone's dinner, not tonight. Betty walked in to the main doors of the diner

only to find the staff was missing. This did not bode well. She went to the managers office where she found an envelope with her name written on it. She opened it to find.....
132.title: The worst payday ever...

choices: She tries the door
She goes up the stairs
She has second thoughts and decides to leave...
1321.content:
Betty looked down at the check in her hands and a weak smile slowly spread across her face. She had been working in this underpaying hellhole for far too long, letting them keep her last paycheck would be a crime against human decency. Sure, there were zombies running around and she probably wouldn't get a chance to use it, but it was the principle of the matter. The diner had been on her way to her destination anyway, and she couldn't bother to pass it up. She had managed to get out of her house safely and was headed in the direction of a safe spot where she would be meeting up with other survivors. Hopefully, well armed and friendly, not that she was in a position to be bargaining. She stuffed the tiny piece of paper into the pocket of her jeans and left the diner, eager to get back together with some humans who were still living. She turned around a street corner and hid behind an abandoned car as a shuffling zombie walked by slowly. She had no weapons, if one of these things caught her before she got to the other survivors she was as good as dead.


She got back up and continued running once she was no longer able to hear nearby footsteps and resumed her perilous journey. Up ahead was the abandoned factory where a passing survivor had told her to go two days ago when she was still hiding out in her house. "I wonder if he made it..." Betty said softly as she climbed over a torn down chain-link fence that looked as if something had clawed its way through it. Betty felt a chill run down her spine as she stepped over it and quickly ran up to the side of the building. Inside see could hear footsteps, people were here! She walked over to the back door and looked inside the broken window. There was some shattered glass on the floor inside along with a (possibly locked) door and a rickey looking stairway that led to the upper floor. Betty took a deep breath and went inside...
1321.title: One last paycheck...

choices: She introduces herself and tells him why she came here
She asks him to tell her who he is before she gives him an answer
13212.content:
The door probably wasn't unlocked so Betty decided to see if she could find a way into the main room from upstairs. From what she could tell all the footsteps were coming from the ground floor so she'd have to find a way back down once she got there. The entire factory was falling apart and covered in rust, but it sure beat wandering around on the rainy streets outside. "I just need to make sure I get a tetanus shot after this is all over..." Betty said as she leaned against the upstairs door and looked through the window. She didn't think there would be any zombies in here, but it never hurt to be cautious. The walkway was clear and out of the corner of her eye she could see a few moving shadows on the ground floor. "Thank god, hopefully they'll help me..." Betty whispered as she slowly opened the door and walked out onto the rickety walkway. She began looking for a way down when a loud explosion sounded from the floor below her and several bodies were flung through the air. "How'd you like that grenade, you undead pieces of shit?!" A voice shouted over the enraged growls of about a dozen angry zombies.


"Oh shit!" Betty cursed as she ran over to get a better view of what caused the explosion. "Did the zombies break through the wall?!" She yelled over the sound of machine gun fire. Below her was about 7 or 8 people getting blow away by a man in a hockey mask. "KILL HIM!!! KILL THAT LITTLE BASTARD!!!!!" The still living ones shouted as they tried to surround him. "Oh my god, I've got to do something..." Betty whispered to avoid alerting the crazed mans attention. "She quickly began looking around for a set of stairs and ran down the first she could find. By the time she had reached the scene of the massacre, however, all that was left was the lone man reloading his now empty gun. "Hold it right there, you damn Mimic!" He growled when he noticed her. "I'm not letting any of you get away after what you did to my grandfather!" The gun clicked and the man leveled it with Betty's chest. "Wait, don't shoot me, please! Why are you doing this?!" She moaned as she took a step back.


The man took a few steps closer and looked into her eyes from behind the mask. He then lowered his gun once he heard her heartbeat. "You... you're not one of them... are you?" He asked in a confused tone as tears began forming in Betty's eyes. "Why? Why are you here if you're not a Mimic?!" He then asked in a more upset tone. "Please... I have no idea what you're talking about... What's a Mimic and why did you kill all those people?" Betty replied as she backed up against a broken down piece of machinery. "Those people? You really don't know what a mImic is? God, you must have been hiding somewhere for these past few days. Anyway, those people you saw were all really zombies. They just look like they are still alive, but their wounds and lack of a heartbeat give them away. Now tell me, why the hell did you come to this factory, didn't you know it was full of Mimics?" Betty shook her head and began to feel stupid. If he hadn't shown up, she would've walked right into a fatal trap. "I'm sorry..." She said as she wiped away some of her tears.
13212.title: Mysterious stranger

choices: Ignore Drake's advice and head to the factories anyway
Try to get to the warehouses downtown and meet up with Drake
Take cover in the diner until the rain lets up
1322.content:
Betty was disappointed to find that not her paycheck, but a note from the manager was all that was in the envelope. She sighed and unfolded the letter. It was written in bright red ink and said:


Betty, I pray you are still alive.

I had a feeling you would come back to the diner at some point, you would never turn down a paycheck even if you had to cut through a horde of zombies to get it. Unfortunately, there's no paycheck here and all of the rest of us have left for the warehouses downtown. We've received word that one warehouse in particular belonged to a gang who ran a chop-shop and we hope to use some spare parts to make us an armored vehicle that can get us out of here. I've made sure to include the directions and address on the back of this paper. I doubt you'd be willing to hike across the city to join us, but I wanted to make sure you knew where we went. Just... whatever you do, stay away from the abandoned factories on Oak street. There's a nest of... things there... they look human, but are zombies as well. They ambushed three guys we sent off to investigate, only one made it back. Betty, if you see something that looks human, but isn't... run! I'm sorry, I know this is dragging on and I'm sure you don't have the time...

Just be careful... and Betty? I'm sorry, we all are.

Assistant manager Drake


Betty re-read the letter one last time before turning it over. Sure enough, on the back were instructions on how to get to the warehouses downtown using the safest routes possible. "Well, I guess I'd better get going... thanks Drake." Betty said as she walked back into the downpour outside. She had planned on meeting up with other survivors at the factory... well, that plan was shot to hell now. Or was it? Drake and his buddies had always picked on her and made her the butt of several of their "practical jokes." She liked to think they wouldn't be so petty if her life was on the line, but...

Suddenly, a chorus of growls sounded off in the distance, the undead drew closer by the second...
1322.title: A cryptic message...

choices: Take the time to look around inside the barber shop
Keep going before you run out of day light
13222.content:
There was no time to waste on the memories of how immature and mean Drake and some of the other people had been to you. It was another time, another place now and the more alive people that could stand together against whatever was happening out there to the world was the only chance of survival.

Not that it really helped, but you'd managed to snatch an umbrella on your way out of the diner and with it held steady over your head you keep reading the lines of direction written on the note. All you needed now was to get lost out here, alone and cold and a snack on legs for some hungry moaning dead people.

So many thoughts wanted to rush through your head. Having to fight hard not to recount your morning that seemed ages ago now, What was happening? Why was this going on... here? In your town, THIS town? It just didn't make sense. Nothing did.

Your mind spinning in a thousand different directions, you almost miss the turn past the old barber shop that will take you along the next part of directions to the hide out. Staying close to the cold brick building and peeking around the corner into the nearly untouched glass store front. Should you go in to see if you can salvage some weapons? Would it even do any good?
13222.title: Try to get to the warehouses downtown and meet ...

choices: You hear a crash at the front of the store and turn back!
You continue towards the light
132221.content:
It is dark inside the shop, you can tell that much just from a quick peek through the glass from outside, but cupping your hands to the side of your face and squinting a bit you see a faint glow of dull light towards the very back of the building. It looks like it may be coming from a bathroom or an office deep within. A slight upwards finger motion to push your glasses back up onto your nose and a tiny sniffle you are ready to see what is inside and slink to the door.

The handle opens without any trouble or sound surprisingly enough. Never taking your eyes off of the path towards the light you plan to take, you lean back on the inside of the door once inside in order to close it just as quietly behind you. BAM! Something flies towards the glass where you just stood half a second ago. Flopping to the floor out of sheer terror you hear screeching noises from outside and whatever it was that crashed into the building. You reach up and fumble in the growing darkness to hook the latch to lock the door and crawl behind some close shelving.

It appears to be even more gloomy and overcast outside through the barely tempered inside shop glass but you see clearly enough a glowing set of eyes and clawed hands to accompany it pressed close to the shop door. So that's what they look like huh? Your heart racing a trillion billion times a minute you wait a few seconds to calm yourself and peek around the other side of the shelving to check for a clear path to the back. Crawling some what awkwardly, half feeling and half forcefully pulling yourself towards the flickering light you say a silent prayer that there are not anymore of what you just seen outside... inside with you.
132221.title: Take the time to look around inside the barber ...

choices: Listen to how Frank came to be trapped in the office
1322211.content:
Shattering glass and angry evil animalistic noises fill your ears. That lurking demented creature smashed its way into the barber shop. You might normally just sit there, and hope it wouldn't find you. That is the way you usually deal with bullies or any other threatening situations but this time... no this time you jump up and fly to the back of the building. Breathing hard, perspiration gathered on your forehead and threatening to trickle down on to your glasses to smudge the lenses you heave a merely whimpering sigh of relief. Your mouth is like cotton that you'd kill for something to drink and there is an onset of what will no doubt be a terrible headache soon but there is no time to worry about all that.

You know that not human THING, is out there and the flimsy wooden door of this small office won't be enough to keep it at bay for long so you let your eyes race all over the tiny cubicle searching. The light, was a flash light lying on the floor under an aluminum, chipped desk. You bend down to pick it up and a hand shoots out of the darkness to grab it first. You almost scream bloody murder but being that your throat is like sandpaper it only croaks in protest and hardly no sound comes out. The blazing light is aimed right at your face and a male voice whispers "are you real?".

"Yes, I'm real. What... what are you doing in here?"

Frank Hughes, had been trapped out of fear in the barber shop employee office for what seemed like weeks. He'd all but given up on ever getting out alive, seeing daylight or another living person. He'd found a gun, it was loaded and he had made the decision to use it right then, before this girl had busted in to his secret prison. This girl, his Angel. She must have been sent from some other place. He wasn't a religious man but this whole encounter made him believe instantly in something greater than himself.

He lowered the light from Betty's face so that she might regain her sight in the surrounding darkness, then he began his story...
1322211.title: You hear a crash at the front of the store and ...

choices: Frank aims the gun above Bettys' head to shoot through it
Frank lunges forward to cover Bettys' mouth to keep her quiet
13222111.content:
"My name is Frank by the way. I didn't think I'd ever be introducing myself to anyone else again, not with all this going on. This madness! But yeah, that's my name. I'm Frank.
Frank Hughes, and I'm an accountant. I wasn't even supposed to be here" he laughs a bit. Just looking off to the side of Betty's head while he talks, almost as if he's afraid to look directly into the girls eyes. Like it was only a dream and maybe he was completely mad and he really was still just alone.

Betty sitting Indian style across from him, with her back against the office door watches him quietly. Listening to him account what the past few days have been like for him trapped in the office, in this building all alone was really sad to her. She cared deeply about other people and hated to hear the sorrow and pity and fear in his voice as he told her about how it had been a normal day for him. Paperwork for Mr. Lyles, the barber shop owner.

Frank sometimes took part in free lance offers, and Mr. Lyles had been a long time friend of his uncle. So when he'd been asked through his uncle if he would come down to the shop to look over Mr. Lyles finances he'd been happy to do it. It had been a pretty, lush spring day. Quite beautiful day, as most of them were in Bitterwood. Idealistic seasons and pretty, neat rowed houses and offices had been what attracted Frank to return to the city a year and a half ago. He'd started his accounting career in New York, and though the business was good and the pay was even better. He'd grown tired of the arrogant and mean spirited co workers at the firm for which he worked.

His family had of course, long since accepted him as a homosexual man and that gave him the confidence to embrace that in his daily life at work too. However, his boss and a few others at his job didn't like him if not only for that one reason. He'd been a bit shocked at first that people in such a big city could still be so back woods about him being gay, but they were and they were not shy about showing it.

He didn't go into detail about the hate that presented itself almost daily at his job from his fellow co workers to Betty though. He could tell she was young and perhaps a bit naive and so he only casually brushed upon this top of out-casted-ness he had felt. He noticed she was watching him closely, even though he wasn't looking directly into her eyes she was in fact never taking hers off of his face.

Frank went on to tell the girl about his return to Bitterwood and open armed acceptance into the town where he'd been born. Then met back to the point where he'd spend his last normal day here in Mr. Lyles office. It had been a Tuesday, mid afternoon and the shop was never really bustling with customers or activity but there had been a steady low murmur of shop talk to be heard from the outside of the office door that day.

Frank had been going about his business, scratching his head at some figures and making mental notes about a few lines of numbers to ask Mr. Lyles about when he'd gotten a chance. Everything seemed perfectly normal and even pleasant until ... the screams.

Almost as though it had been planned to play out that exact way, as soon as the words had left his lips, there was a new set of screaming going on again right outside the office door...
