Soon the zombies managed to bring down the door and attack in greater numbers, but it made no real difference as the two survivors continued to pick them off before they could get too close. In a few minutes the hallway was covered in corpses and the zombies had to crawl over the pile of their fallen brethren just to get away from the doorway. Shannon began to wonder why they didn't attack the window too instead of just rushing to their doom in the narrow passage that she and her companion had no trouble defending. Could they really be this stupid? Or were they setting a trap...?
15121.title: Pile up

choices: Let the Digger kill Ray and finish off the remaining zombies
Try to save Ray and hope she isn't overrun in the process
151212.content: "Maybe I'm just imaging things..." Shannon thought to herself. "Damn it, this is no time to lose my cool." She gave herself a light smack on the cheek to help focus and resumed fighting. "You okay?" Ray asked as he blew away a zombie badger's head. "You seemed to zone out there for a minute." "Yeah, I'm fine..." Shannon replied. Soon the noise outside grew quieter, the siege was almost over. "There's only a few left, let's wrap this up!" Ray called as he began to reload his gun for the final confrontation with the last few zombies outside. "Yeah, I'll be glad when t-" Shannon began, but was cut off by the sound of busting wood and something invading their safe zone. It was a Digger. "Oh shit, what the hell's that?!" Ray exclaimed as he turned around to face this new horror. The Digger had taken advantage of the distress the fighting above it had caused and snuck up on them unnoticed. Wasting no time, it shot 3 tentacules from its mouth and ensnared Ray. His foes attack caught him by surprise and Ray dropped his gun as the Digger pulled him to the floor. "Shit! Ray!" Shannon yelled as she was forced to hold off the newly approaching zombies by herself. Ray could only struggle as his attacker pulled him to his doom, he couldn't even scream as the tentacule around his neck tried to choke the life out of him. "Damn it, let go of him!" Shannon shouted as she fired another shot at the door. The zombies were pouring in full force now, their remaining numbers able to attack in larger groups with Ray incapacitated. Shannon wanted desperately to help Ray, but she could barely hold back the zombies as it was. The Digger raised one of its claws as Ray came into striking distance. This was it, Shannon had one last chance to save Ray. If she didn't take a shot now the Digger would kill him, but the zombies weren't going to let up their final assult any time soon. What should she do?
151212.title: Tough choice

1512121.content: Shannon forced herself to look away from her fallen comrade and continue the fight alone. She shivered a bit as she heard the sound of flesh being torn and blood spilling onto the floor. The only zombies left were 2 level 1's and a level 2. Shannon quickly killed them without much of a fight, the zombie's assault on the rifle range was finally over. Except it wasn't. Just as Shannon was about to gather up her stuff and leave, something grabbed her leg and wrapped around it. A tentacule! While putting an end to zombies that were an immediate threat she had forgotten all about the Digger that she had let kill Ray. Shannon tried to turn around and kill the last zombie standing between her and survival, but the Digger quickly disabled both of her arms with more of its tentacules. Shannon had one chance left as she was being pulled to her death. She had not dropped her shotgun and if she could aim it in time she might get a clear shot at its head. Just as she was about to be pulled underground she got a good look at its head and raised her gun as best she could to fire. Unfortunately, when she tried pulling the trigger nothing happened. "WHAT?!" Shannon thought to herself as she was pulled under. "I just reloaded this thing!" She wouldn't live long enough to realize that while the gun was indeed loaded, it was also jammed with one of the Diggers severed tentacules. The one that first grabbed her foot was a simple distraction. While Shannon was worrying about being captured the Digger had been disarming her only weapon. Shame that Ray was dead by this point, he could have warned her...
1512121.title: Filling a grave

choices: Shannon waits for Ray to wake up before heading out
Shannon hoists Ray up over her shoulders and gets the hell out of there
1512122.content: Shannon rushed over towards Ray and the Digger just as the final wave of zombies came pouring in the doorway. She would have five seconds to free Ray and resume engaging the enemy, five seconds MAX. She rushed over to her captured friend and kicked the Digger's claw away right as it brought it down to finish off Ray. The Digger quickly made another swipe at her with its other clawed hand, but she was able to leap out of the way and catch herself on her free hand. With the Digger's defences down Shannon finally had a shot at its head. And she took it. Although it was much harder to hold a gun up and aim with one hand, Shannon managed just fine. She squeezed the trigger on the shotgun as tight as she could and fired a single blast at her target. She wouldn't have a second chance, this would be it, if this attack missed the Digger would get a free shot at her vitals. Luckily, she had hit her target... right in the head. Shannon landed on her feet as bits of brain and skull splashed onto the walls and ceiling. Ray fell to the floor as the tentacules were severed from their owner. He would have confessed an unending love for Shannon right then and there if he had not been unconsious. As the headless Digger's body slid back underground Shannon turned back towards the hallway. A level 2 was just a foot away from her and was quick to swing its claws at her face, but she was able to duck under them just in time. Spinning around as she got back up let her get in a powerful blow from the butt of her shotgun that sent the level 2 flying into the last few zombies left, knocking them all to the ground. The five seconds were up by now, Ray was free, the Digger was dead, and Shaanon was still alive and kickin ass. With all the real danger gone Shannon was able to have some fun as she mowed down the last of undead with a smile on her face.
1512122.title: Digging a grave

choices: Headed west towards the city
Headed east towards the gas station
15121222.content:
As soon as the body of the last zombie hit the floor Shannon went over to check on Ray. He was still out of it, but at least he was breathing. After securing her shotgun and pistol she hoisted Ray over her shoulders and began carrying him towards the door. "Christ, you're heavy!" She groaned as she opened the door. "You picked a wonderful time to go all dead weight on me, now I gotta carry your ass..." She walked outside and listened carefully for sounds of movement. Fortunately, all she heard was the cool night air blowing through the trees. She continued moving north down the shooting range's driveway and stepped out onto the abandoned dirt road. On the other side above a drainage ditch she could see an old sign in the darkness which read:

<----- Bitterwood city limits 7 miles

-----> Firemare gas station 1 mile

Just below that someone had scratched:

Leave the city. All is lost. If you are reading this DON'T GO INTO THE CITY!

Shannon also noticed an R in a circle that had been painted near the arrow pointing towards the gas station. She wasn't sure what it meant, but had a feeling it might be worth checking out. She looked in both directions and listened once more for sound. Again, all she heard was the peaceful sounds of the air swirling through the trees. She shook Ray a little to try and wake him up. No response. It looks like she'd be making this decision alone. She took a deep breath and...
15121222.title: Which way?

choices: Check the place out
Move on
151212221.content: Shannon decided it would be best to head back into the city, despite the signs warning. The city may be full of zombies, but at least they would have access to more resources there... and its not like there wasn't just as many zombies out here in the middle of nowhere. The dirt road leading back towards Bitterwood went uphill for about half a mile before connecting to the main road which had much less of an incline. There were several gravel driveways that led deeper into the surrounding woods, but since Shannon had no way of knowing how far back they went or how many zombies might be inside she kept moving along the main road looking for a place to rest. About an hour later, just as Shannon was about to fall over from exhaustion, she spied a working light up ahead inside a window. After getting a little closer she saw that the whole house was lit up, perhaps the only place with power for miles. Best of all, though, was the fact that it was located only about 15 yards off the road up a small hill. There was even a large red truck parked in the driveway. Making sure to say out of view of the window Shannon walked up and checked the mailbox. 375 Sparrow rd. The placed seemed innocent enough and she did need a rest... yet something told her it would be best to just move on. There was something wrong here, something very wrong. What will she do?
151212221.title: How convenient...

choices: Investigate the crashed truck
Move on
151212222.content: Even though she was carrying Ray on her back, Shannon was able to walk at a fairly quick pace along the darkened road. At this rate she would be at the gas station in about half an hour. As she moved along she was sure to keep an eye out for any trace of red in the shadows. She and Ray would be easy prey like this and she wasn't going to let those bastards get them if she could help it. Her pistol was easily accessible and fully reloaded, but her shotgun wasn't. One or two weak zombies right now wouldn't be much of a problem. If she were to run into a large group, however, she would have a hell of a fight on her hands. Luckily, she hadn't seen a single zombie since she left the shooting range, not even a Beast. After ten more minutes had passed she noticed something odd up ahead of her. It was to far away to be seen clearly, especially at night. She walked a little slower and tried not to make any noise as she got closer. When she was only a few yards away she was able to tell what it was. An overturned pickup truck was laying in the ditch off to the side of the road. The windows were broken, the side was scratched to hell and, Shannon couldn't be sure, but she thought she saw some blood on the passenger side window. It mush have been quite a gruesome wreak, she doubted if anyone was still alive inside. Shannon was about to move on when she thought she heard a voice. It was soft and gentle, like a child's voice. She could have sworn it said "Help meee..." This can't be real, there was no way a kid could have survived that crash... and yet... it seemed that one just might have. Shannon listened again. A few minutes passed... nothing but the ever-present sound of the wind in the trees blowing softly in the night...
151212222.title: That's a nasty damn wreak...

1512122221.content:
Against her better judgement Shannon decided to make sure no one was alive inside the truck. She walked over to the passenger side window and looked inside. In the darkness she could make out two figures. One was suspended from its seat. He must have been the driver, still wearing his seat belt... not that it had done him any good. The smaller figure was laying on the ceiling of the truck and was obviously a child. He seemed to be wearing a hat and his right leg was twisted, broken, and caught on something near the dashboard. The horrible sight was all Shannon could bear. She almost tore her gaze away and moved on...

Something caught her eye.

From deep within the darkness of the destroyed vehicle two small eyes opened wide. They glowed a bright red and illuminated the face of the child who had just returned to life. The freshly revived creature smiled at Shannon, a smile filled with sharp teeth and not a hint of joy. Shannon stood motionless, her mind nearly snapped trying to piece together what was going on. All she could do was make a noise that sounded like a soft moan as the Stalker began to free itself from its confinement. Sounds of ripping and tearing filled the air... followed by the sound of a snap and blood gushing from where the boys leg had been. Shannon came to her senses and tried to back away, but it was too late. The Stalker leapt with superhuman agility and tackled both Shannon and Ray to the ground, apparently missing a leg didn't slow the monster down at all. Its claws were ripping through Shannons flesh before she had fully realized what had just happened. The last thing she saw before passing out was the zombie making its way over towards an unconscious Ray...
1512122221.title: Ghastly discovery

choices: Shannon checks the inside of the station
Shannon checks out the small car garage
1512122222.content: Shannon shook her head as she stepped away from the crash scene and continued towards the gas station. "Damn, girl. All this zombie shit is messin with your head. Focus." She remembered what her commanding officer had said when she first arrived at boot camp. That no matter the situation, it could always get worse and falling apart would lead to death. Only by keeping your mind on your current objective would you be able to survive. Shannon had found this advice very useful during her time in Iraq, without it she might've died like some of her friends. The memories of what she had seen and experienced with her comrades provided a bittersweet escape to her situation and allowed her to remain calm and collected as she moved down the road. Her friends had died with honor and she sure as hell wasn't going to disgrace their memory by whining about the hand she had been dealt or running away like a coward. If the zombies did get her, she would go down fighting. With new resolve and determination she continued onwards. After another ten minutes had passed she came to the gas station, sitting innocently on the side of the road as if nothing was wrong. It even seemed... welcoming in a creepy sort of way. It was pretty nice for being located in the middle of nowhere, no blood or dead bodies, and it even had a small garage off to the side. Shannon half expected some friendly attendant or mechanic to appear from inside and greet her with a smile as she walked past an abandoned semi truck parked in front of the building. She opened the door slowly and was startled when a small bell rang, but fortunately no one was around to hear it. She walked into the dimly lit room and laid Ray behind the counter where he would be safest until he woke up. Shannon didn't think anyone was around, but decided it was best to quickly look it over and see if she could find anything useful. She left her shotgun with Ray so she could travel light and made sure her pistol was still fully loaded. The last thing she did as she walked off was grab a plastic bag, intending to have it full of supplies by the time she returned.
1512122222.title: Reststop

choices: Outside
The garage
15121222221.content: The inside of the gas station was fairly large and looked surprisingly calm in the moonlight that flowed in from the outside. Shannon was sure that both she and Ray were alone here, but she wasn't complaining. The easier the job, the quicker she would get done. The first thing she did was fill the bag half full with the various snacks that were lining the shelves. After she had what she was sure was enough for a few days she headed towards the back near the the freezers. Several bottles of liquid shone brilliantly in the dim light. Everything from sports drinks to beer were on display waiting to be enjoyed by whoever was lucky enough to find them. Shannon filled most of the rest of the bag full of energy drinks and water and grabbed a beer for herself. It wasn't cold as the power must have been out for days, but it was the most refreshing drink Shannon had had in her entire life. She downed the last of the bottle and tossed it aside. She still had a little room in her bag... should she look for more supplies outside or in the garage?
15121222221.title: A few refreshments...

choices: Stay here and sleep.
Continue to search for a proper shelter.
151212222212.content:
"I think I have some more space in my bag, I'm going to find supplies in the garage." Shannon said. as she greeted Ray, who had finally woken back up. "I'll stay here." Ray replied, holding his gun like it was his only thing left. She went in the garage, found some gas cans and nothing else in here. She walked out, and groaned. "Only gas cans."

Ray finished taking a smoke as he looked at Shannon. "Gas cans? Try searching outside then, don't go too far. I will stay here till you get back." He tossed the cigarette away .

Shannon walked to a candy shop just across the station and went in. A bunch of candy was in here. She would need energy, so Shannon grabbed some candy bars and left. She ran back to Ray and stood there. "Where do we go now?" Asked Ray.








(Hey guys, I'm writing in this story again!)
151212222212.title: Better safe than sorry.

choices: Head on out to the farmhouse
Ignore it and keep moving down the road
1512122222122.content: "Well, we sure as hell can't stay here." Shannon said as she looked over the gas station. "It'd be hard to defend from the inside and there's too many ways for the zombies to get inside." She turned to Ray and hoped he might have some idea of where to go. "The farthest I've gone since I moved here was the shooting range so I don't know the area very well. Do you know where we might find someplace safe?" Ray scratched his head for a moment before answering. "I'm afraid not, hon. I just came out this way on hunting trips every month or so. I think there's a small town further down the road, but I don't know if its safe..." Shannon and Ray stood silent as they thought over their options. "Hell, It'll be daybreak soon, so I don't see any point in resting. Let's try to find that town you mentioned." Shannon said as she dug a few energy drinks out of her bag. She tossed one to Ray and they began moving further down the road, away from the gas station and candy store that looked like something you might see on a postcard or calendar. They could only hope this town they were headed to was in as good a condition, and more importantly, safe. The road was dark and the two were still exhausted from their ordeals, but they kept a positive attitude. Just as the sun began rising about an hour later the forest around them started to wear thin. Soon enough they were walking down a road not lined by trees, but fields covered in wet, dewey grass and surrounded by barbed wire fences to keep the livestock in. Too bad all the livestock were now dead or perhaps zombiefied. The two lone survivors slowed their pace a little and took the time to view their now more vast surroundings carefully. They could see much farther ahead, but so could the zombies, if anything they would now have to be more vigilant. They came to a downed power line that was laying across the road which they were able to simply step over, yet couldn't help but feel was a bad sign. Finally, the two came to a driveway that led up to a farmhouse about a mile off the road. Next to it was a barn and a large pond with a dock. It seemed safe and they did need a rest... what should they do?
1512122222122.title: Darkness before dawn

choices: Shannon
Ray
15121222221221.content: A level three zombie wanders outside the barn, Ray gave him a nice bullet to the head. The zombie looks at them and walks towards them, Ray kept on shooting his head till he dropped. "What kind of bitch was that?" Shannon asked. "I don't know, It has a weird marking on his head." Ray replied, walking in the barn. A large growl came and they looked behind themselves. A giant Deathtouch came towards them. They ran in and closed the door as Ray barricaded the entrance. "Who will go up the roof and kill that bitch?" Shannon asked.
15121222221221.title: Zombies! Just one.

choices: Ray offers to do it
Shannon decides to do it
151212222212212.content:
"I'll take care of him." Ray said as he began climbing a nearby ladder. "You just worry about keeping that thing out while I get in to position. Think you can handle that, hon?" Shannon gave him a thumbs up as she moved a nearby barrel into place against the door. "Okay then, this time I'll be the one who rescues you." Ray said, determined to prove his worth to his ally. Once he reached the upper floor he moved quickly and silently to the front window and took careful aim with his shotgun. The thing was almost to the door, he couldn't let it get in no matter what. The air was soon filled with the sound of several loud blasts as Ray emptied his mid-range weapon into his foe. The Deathtouch took the full force of every hit, causing it to stumble backwards onto its back. Ray was sure his work was done as he surveyed the damage he had dealt the monster. Two rounds had torn away half its face and the rest had reduced its body to swiss cheese which caused a thick redish-black liquid to pour from its wounds. Strangely the mist around it seemed to grow as it bled and it was soon struggling to get back to its feet. "No fuckin way...!" Ray gasped as he began to franticly reload his weapon. He had almost fully reloaded the shotgun when his fingers came back empty after digging through his shotgun shell pouch. These would be his last shots... and he'd damn well better make them count. Before firing again he shouted a warning down to Shannon. "That thing is still alive, get away from the door. I don't know how it survived my attack, but it did and its starting to spew more of that noxious gas shit."


Down below Shannon couldn't believe her ears, she clearly heard Ray empty his gun into that thing and drop it. How could it be getting up now? She decided to worry about these thoughts later, however, when a thick red mist began filling the interior of the barn through the cracks in the door. "Ugh, shit!" Shannon cursed as she quickly began making her way up the ladder. As she climbed she heard several more shots ring out... along with the sound of tearing flesh. Ray had once again unloaded his weapon into the zombie, hopefully with better luck this time. Shannon quickly joined him at the window and looked down at their enemy. It was harder to see in the cloud of gas now erupting from its mangled innards, but both survivors could clearly make out twitching movements. The thing was still alive. "Fuck..." Shannon gasped under her breath. "Well thats it, I'm out of ammo." Ray said flatly. He could visibly be seen sweating now as he tracked the movements of the Deathtouch as it tried to get closer to the door. "There's only one idea I have left..." He said quietly. "That damn things gas is filling this place fast, in another few minutes we'll suffocate, but we can't leave through the front door. The only other way is out the window on the other end of the barn, I saw some bails of hay lined up along that side when we started walking out here. We should be able to jump down safely, but while we're getting back up that thing could move around the barn and kill us. Ultimately, one of us will have to stay behind to distract it while the other makes a run for it." He stood silently waiting to hear Shannon's reaction as he kept an eye on the Deathtouches movements. Shannon opened her mouth and in a grim voice replied. "Damn it... you're right. So... who... who gets left behind?"
151212222212212.title: A touch... and taste... of death.

choices: She wakes up several hours later
1512122222122121.content:
Ray pulled out a cigarette, put it in his mouth and lit it with his zippo. He took it back out, blew a puff of smoke, and said in a firm, almost heroic tone. "I'll do it. You get yourself the hell out of this place." Shannon was about to argue against his decision when a cough escaped her lips, the smoke was getting worse. "You're still a pretty young thing..." Ray said as he ran a hand through her hair. "I'm not gonna let you end your life in a place like this. Get out of here, survive, and don't let this beat you. Use the life I'm giving you for something." Shannon spoke no words, she didn't have to. Ray knew exactly what see was about to say. She leaned in and kissed him on the cheek before turning around and walking towards the other window. "I know." Ray said with a smile as he began to make his way down the ladder for the final time. Once on the ground floor again Ray grabbed a pitchfork he had seen laying against the wall when they came in. Just as he was about to open the door he heard a few parting words from Shannon:

"Thank you."


Ray smiled one last time, flicked his cigarette onto the ground, and opened the door.

A single scream echoed across the farm as he made his final stand against a foe he had no hope of defeating.

Shannon took a deep breath, closed her eyes and leapt from the window. She felt as if the entire would had disappeared as she plummeted downwards. If she missed the hay it would all be over. Ray would have sacrificed himself senselessly, she would be dead, and nothing they had done over the past 24 hours would matter. For perhaps the first time in her life she prayed for help, she didn't want to do this alone. The next sound she heard was that of her body making contact with the ground, which thankfully was covered by about two and a half inches of hay. She hurt all over, but she was overjoyed to be alive. She struggled to get up and to her surprise... she could! Her feet returned to solid ground as she forced herself to stay upright and keep moving. By this point she was moving on will alone and had almost no idea of where she was going. She rounded the edge of the barn just in time to see a severed red hand crawling in her direction. She turned away from it and jogged as fast as she could to escape it. After what felt like hours her own hand came to a doorknob, which she turned quickly in her frenzied state of mind. Barely retaining the presence of mind to close the door back behind her she entered the farmhouse. She began climbing the nearby stairs and was soon on the top floor. She darted past a bathroom and by sheer luck stumbled into the master bedroom. She let out a deep sigh as she collapsed on the bed and drifted off to sleep.
1512122222122121.title: Goodbye

choices: Shannon looks for her discarded gun outside
Shannon searches the house for new weapons
15121222221221211.content: The sun was setting when Shannon finally reopened her eyes. Her whole body was sore all over, she was covered in mud, and she had lost a dear friend. She sat up on the soft mattress and felt for her gun. It wasn't there. She couldn't remember exactly what had happened earlier this morning, but she had somehow either dropped or lost it on her way inside. She was defenseless, she was heartbroken, and she was alone in a strange house. A zombie could have walked into the room at any minute while she was out and had a free kill. She pressed her head into the sheets and tried to think. She had decent hand-to-hand combat skills and could take out a level one, but if anything else crossed her path she was as good as dead. After sitting there for a half hour in her own misery she finally began to cry. Tears flowed down her face for the first time in over a year. She wasn't sure if she was crying because she had finally realized that Ray was gone, she would probably be next, or the shame of self pity. She wiped her tears away and got up off the bed. She gave herself a hard smack across the face to snap herself out of it. She was beginning to let things get to her... and she knew she was better then that. "Ray... Tina... Brad... Jerry... Alan... Greg..." She moaned quietly to herself as she regained control of her emotions. "My squad mates, my savior, my... friends... I'm through letting people down. I promise... I promise I'll survive no matter what!" She felt a little better now that the guilt that had been eating away at her was numbed a little. She walked into the upstairs hallway and began forming a plan...
15121222221221211.title: Bitter twilight

choices: Enter the store. Hell, they are humans!
Fuck no. Zombies are in there! I'd rather find supplies outside.
151212222212212112.content: Shannon realized this used to be a barricaded house as she saw many things guarding the windows and other places, but it seems the front door was destroyed after she had come in and the people in here had all died. So she looked around and found a decent assault rifle which had 2 clips left. She checked it and it turned out to be an Ak-47. She grabbed the clips and checked around some more for supplies. No luck. She looks out the upstairs window and sees a store just a little farther up the road with people moving inside. Could it be zombies or humans? The light was turned on and the front door of the store was heavily barricaded with strong metal bars and objects. That shows there are humans inside, but... there's a chance they may be zombies... So, does Shannon check the store out or try to find more supplies and stay away from the store?
151212222212212112.title: Survive.

choices: She shoots him and continues on to the store
She loses her nerve at the last second and tries to flee
1512122222122121121.content: Shannon usually had no problems doing things herself, but Rays recent death had left her a bit shaken. She felt that joining up with more survivors was the best plan, at least for now. After checking outside for Deathtouch remains and seeing that it was all clear she left the abandoned farmhouse, her new AK-47 ready to annihilate anything she came across. She was once again prepared to fight for her life, it was the least she could do for her fallen comrades. As she walked pass the barn, she noticed something moving somewhere inside. Quickly, she aimed her AK at the entrance and prepared to fire, but the figure that had been moving just inside the door soon revealed itself and Shannon froze. There, standing in the early shadows of the evening was Ray. His body was intact and almost looked human, the only revealing feature that told Shannon he was a zombie were his glowing hate-fill red eyes. He let out a deep and saddening moan as he shuffled forward, his former life completely forgotten. He was only a level one and posed no real threat to Shannon, but could she really kill him? He had given his life for hers, he had spared her the fate of becoming one of the walking dead. Would she shoot him in cold blood simply because he had lost a heartbeat and gained a lust for violence. She kept her gun focused on him as he got closer ...and closer. Her finger was on the trigger, but could she pull it?
1512122222122121121.title: Reunion

choices: She tries the back door
She heads for the town
15121222221221211211.content: At the last possible second, seconds before Ray reached her, Shannon felt her hands shake as a round of bullets escaped her AK and and hit Ray in the chest, a single one piercing his heart. He took a final step and fell over dead, this time permanently. Shannon walked over to check his body, he had a few bullets she could use for her Ak-47 in one of his bullet pouches along his belt, along with a few other different types. She put the ammo in her pockets and bowed her head in a moment of silence for her friend. After she had moved his body to the inside of the barn and covered it with a tarp she continued down the driveway and back onto the main road. The short trip to the store was uneventful and no other zombie showed its face after Ray appeared. The store itself was little more than a tiny mom and pop grocery store that was likely going out of business if the colorful paper signs in the windows were to be believed. The place barely even had a parking lot with only enough spaces for 12 cars, give or take. Shannon knew that if it had any survivors inside it, however, it could be the most valuable building for miles. She knocked on the front doors and tried to see inside, but nothing answered her or even moved. It didn't help that the only thing she could see on the inside were a bunch of shopping carts lined in a row. She stepped away from the door for a second and looked further up the road. There was a burned down church up ahead and beyond that Shannon could make out a few buildings in the darkness. That must be the town Ray was talking about. She was about to move on when she realized that their must be a back door to this place. She could try that... or she could move on to the town.
15121222221221211211.title: A second Goodbye...

choices: They are zombies!
They are humans, with the church as their base.
151212222212212112112.content:
Shannon decided that the town would have some supplies, so she wandered into the outskirts of the quiet and lonely town. A few miles ahead something was moving inside the church. Suddenly something walked out of the church. She thought: "Zombies can't enter churches..."


She moved towards them to find out....
151212222212212112112.title: The church.

choices: Shannon decides to keep searching
Shannon leaves with her new knife and heads towards the town
1512122222122121121121.content: "No it can't be!" Shannon gasped as the zombies drew closer. "I thought churches were protected!" She was deeply confused, but didn't let that throw her off her guard. 15121222221221211211211.content:
Shannon wasn't sure if it was the ruined beauty or the mysterious atmosphere, but something deep down was calling her to the church. She couldn't leave yet. If she had found a knife just sitting here in the debris who knows what else she might find. She decided to check the altar next, which was relatively untouched by the huge blaze that had consumed the church. Upon checking the back she found a scorched bible and what seemed to be a diary of some kind. Sadly the bible couldn't be read from the damage done and the diary was missing its key. "Oh well, guess I'll check the back room. Maybe I'll have more luck in there." She said hopefully as she walked through another burned doorway. The back room was fairly simple, it only had a bed, a ruined chair, and a small singed table inside it. Shannon was about to turn around and leave when something caught her eye. The bed was positioned oddly, as if someone had been moving it. "What's this...?" Shannon asked as she pulled the bed off to the side.


When she turned to look under where it had been she almost let out a scream in surprise. There was a cellar doorway right in front of her. It had the same strange markings as the knife she had found... along with what looked like a stylized demon head in the center. "Something tells me this wasn't a normal church..." Shannon said grimly as she opened the doors. A foul scent filled the air as the large wooden doors fell to the floor, opening a gateway to deep within the church. Shannon took a deep breath and began walking down the steps before her. When she got to the ground floor she found herself in a small dark hallway lit only by strange candles with glowing red flames. She walked slowly and quietly with the knife out in front of her, ready to strike at anything that jumped out at her. When she came to the end of the hallway she found herself standing in the center of a small square room with three doors. The one on the left was a steel door with chains covering it, preventing anyone from getting inside. The door in the center and the one on her right, however, were just simple wooden doors she could easily kick down if turning the knob didn't work. Shannon thought for a moment and decided to...

151212222212212112112112.content:
Shannon tried to turn the knob, only for it to break off in her hand. "Wow, this place is in a really bad state of disrepair." She thought as she pushed the flimsy door open, releasing more of the foul scent she had smelled earlier. The hallway that stood before her was even more narrow then the one that led her here, but it still had those same red candles providing illumination. Shannon prepared herself for whatever waited for her and began walking. At the end of the hallway was a set of old wooden stairs that creaked and groaned as she carefully descended them. Once she got to the bottom she followed one last hallway to another door. This one wasn't just any wooden door, however, it had the same pattern as the cellar doorway and was made of metal. Shannon turned the handle and to her surprise, the door opened with a loud groan. A blast of cold air immediately hit her in the face as she stepped inside the large rectangular room, causing a chill to run down her spine. The inside was truly horrific, dried blood lined the walls, satanic looking symbols were etched all over the place, and in the center was a large alter overlooking several benches.


The entire place looked like some kind of giant twisted church you'd expect demons to worship at. For perhaps the first time since this whole thing started Shannon felt truly horrified of her enemies. She walked down the center past the rows of empty seats and up to the alter. A large challis filled with blood set upon it along with a leather book with strange symbols on it. Yet it was hardly noticed by Shannon as she looked ahead to what was just beyond it. Rows of tables were lined up next to strange machines. Over half of them with grotesque human remains lying on their surfaces. Shannon felt sick to her stomach as she walked past them, unable to take her eyes off the mangled corpses. More than one table didn't even have a human on it, only blood and bits of gore. When she finally got to the end of this horrible little tour she threw up against the wall and slumped to her knees. She was shocked that any thinking human could be capable of such atrocities, yet here they were. Shannon slowly got back to her feet and forced herself to move on. She soon came to another set of stairs that led to the upper floor that overlooked the rest of this floor. There was only one door at the top for her to open and at this point she didn't want to, but couldn't bring herself to leave it. What was on the other side wasn't any more horrors, thankfully, but still more stairs. She could go up... or down...
151212222212212112112112.title: A little slice of hell

On the upper level, there were many chambers. Shannon opened one of them and.... a zombie jumped out. She quickly stabbed it in the head and stepped back, it was dead. She quickly went back down to the level she had just come from and looked up, no more zombies up there. "Why was there a zombie in there?" She said. Shannon got out of the church and looked around a little bit more. There was a store at the north that leads to the city with.... lights flashing around. She heard helicopter sounds and a lot of gunfire. Could this be a rescue?




Should she head towards it, or not?

15121222221221211211211211.content:
Shannon made a mad dash back towards the store and couldn't believe her own eyes when see got close enough to see what was going down. Not one, but TWO helicopters were circling the store, which was now in flames and surrounded by a growing mob of zombies. One of the two helicopters was an Apache complete with hellfire missiles and a powerful machine gun, the other was a simple civilian transport helicopter with no weapons. Inside and outside the store the gunfire was audible as the last few survivors for miles fought for their lives. Once she got within 30 yards Shannon could see that the parking lot was one big pile of corpses, both human and zombie. Knowing that she had no hope of facing the mob surrounding the store with just a knife Shannon waited for the Apache to thin their number a bit. After only a few minutes, however, it became apparent that for every one of the ghouls that went down two more would take its place.


At this rate the people inside the store would be overwhelmed and the helicopter would run out of ammo. There was nothing Shannon could do, but watch as the zombies kept pouring out from their hiding places as they continued their ghastly siege. Shannon felt a tear roll down her cheek, it was all for nothing, Ray had died for nothing, the people fighting for their lives would die for nothing, and soon after she would die for nothing, cold and alone out in the middle of nowhere. She had come so very far... for absolutely nothing. In a fit of anger and frustration she plunged the knife into the ground, cutting her hand in the process. Then, something truly amazing happened. The blade grew blood red and seemed to absorb the blood that had fallen on it. Shannon opened her watery eyes and stared at the blade and then her hand. What had she just done? The zombies began to move away from their target... and towards Shannon!

Shannon stabbed all the zombies that were near here and looked in front of her. The helicopter has landed and seen her. "Get in!" A person armed with heavy amour and weapons shouted as he shot the zombies behind her. "QUICK!!!" Another one shouted. Shannon ran towards the helicopter and a large Deathtouch appeared from the west. That made her run even quicker. She finally reached the helicopter and got up. "Quick! Get up now!" Shannon shouted at the two members as the helicopter prepared to fly off. "I'll stay here, that large shit needs something to kill!" One of them shouted. The Deathtouch grew closer to the helicopter as the other one jumped out and shot the Deathtouch. "GET UP!!!!" Another one yelled. But too late, the helicopter has left. Making it impossible for anyone else to get up.


As the last member stood at the heliport the Deathtouch crashed him into the ground and looked at the helicopter. It roared as a nuke dropped down into the zombie city that was once a peaceful city. It exploded and was shattered into millions of pieces. "Why is there a sacrifice everytime?" Shannon thought as the sun rose...

On September 21, 20XX the city of Bitterwood, Pennsylvania was overrun by legions of the undead. To stop the spread of this growing horror the U.S. government dropped a nuke on the city, annihilating everything within miles. The total death toll is believed to to over 50,000.

It is unknown was caused this strange event, but due to the findings of one survivor, Shannon Hawking, black magic was likely involved. Sadly, nothing could be proven and any possible culprits who committed this heinous crime remain shrouded in mystery. In the wake of the cites destruction a beacon of hope managed to shine through. Over 99% of the zombies were killed in the blast, with the stragglers being mopped up by the armed forces shortly after. choices: Epilogue
151212222212212112112112112.content:
With all her remaining strength Shannon hurled the knife as far as she could, causing it to land out of sight in the nearby field. The zombies kept moving, closer and closer... soon they would be upon her. She braced herself for what was to come and raised her hands, even now, she wouldn't go down without a fight. Just as she was about to throw her last punch at the lead zombie... it darted right past her! Shannon watched in relieved surprise as the undead moved by her towards the place where their precious ritual knife had fallen. Seeing her chance as the numbers around her thinned out Shannon began running towards the store, praying someone inside was still alive. It was at this moment the pilot of the Apache saw his chance as well, and took it. He fired one of the helicopters few remaining hellfire missiles at the tightly clustered group of zombies. Shannon barely noticed it though, even as it whizzed by mere feet above her head.


There was a loud boom and dirt and grass was sent flying high into the chilly night air. The force of the explosion nearly knocked Shannon down, but she kept from stumbling and made it to the front of the store where a small group of people where exiting to see who their savior was. They weren't former soldiers like Shannon, they were just ordinary folks, moms and dads, best friends, innocent kids. They all had weapons of some sort, but their bloody clothes and smiling faces shown that they were glad that the nightmare was almost over. The civilian helicopter made a quick landing amidst the gore-coated parking lot and some military officers began loading people up while the Apache finished mopping up the nearby stragglers. Shannon was the last on board, making sure that no one got left behind. One in the air she began talking to the people she had just help save. They talked bout everything from friends and family to the loved ones that didn't make it through this disaster. Some tears were shed and some people smiled for the first time in days.


Shannon took one final look out the window of the helicopter as it flew away from the city she had called home... and marveled at the beautiful sunrise that began a brand new day...

1512122222122121121121121121.title: The veteran of two wars finds peace

choices: She gets the badge the corpse had
She checks the rooms for a badge
1512122222122121121121122.content:
The set of metal stairs that led deeper into the bowels of this twisted place seemed to go on almost endlessly. It didn't help that with the dim lighting Shannon could only see about 10 feet in front of her. The steps made no groans or creaks as she made her way down them, which deeply unnerved her. No noise but the sound of her own breathing... and heartbeat. She kept the knife at her side, ready to carve up anything that attacked her... if anything attacked her. It got colder the deeper she went and she soon found herself shivering. as she watched her every breath escape her lips slowly. When she finally came to another metal door with the same pattern as the two before she actually felt relieved. She pulled the massive door open slowly and found herself in what looked like a research facility. There were several hallways and doors that led to rooms with big glass display windows, some of which were smeared with blood, broken, or both. A lone bit of bloody graffiti covered one of the walls reading "The end has come. Judgement day is here." in bold letters. Shannon began walking down one of the halls, trying her best not to look inside the windows at the horrid experiments contained within. Up ahead was a table with 2 body bags laying on it. Small body bags. Shannon bit her lip and felt a tear roll down her face. "For fuck's sake... what kind of monsters...?" She couldn't bring herself to finish and kept moving until she came to yet another flight of stairs that connected this floor with the one below it.


Shannon took one last look behind her at the empty hallway and moved down the stairs slowly and carefully. She didn't trust this place. The lights were still working, it was clean and sterile except for the blood and corpses, and, worst of all, it was completely empty. The bottom floor was no better then the one above it and was, in fact, even worse. Piles of body bags were littered about, including a room filed with at least a hundred or so, all completely visible through the large glass windows. Up ahead a corpse was leaning against a wall, an old one judging by its state of decay. His gender was only determinable by reading the I.D. badge on the shirt he was wearing under his lab coat. In his hand was an 8mm handgun and in his head was a single hole from a bullet fired by said gun. Shannon looked away as she pulled the gun from the dead man's cracking fingers and checked it. It had four bullets left. Shannon took it with her and continued on, wondering what horrors were still in store for her. She made it through two more hallways and came to a big steel door that required an identification badge of level 3 or higher. Was that corpse's I.D. badge three or higher? She didn't know, but didn't want to have to go searching for a different once in this fucked up place.

What does she do?
1512122222122121121121122.title: At least these corpses don't move...

choices: Play the recording
Take it with her and listen to it later
15121222221221211211211222.content:
Shannon had no choice, that decayed man looked like he had been a scientist and probably only had low level clearance. If she wanted to get inside she would need to find a badge that she knew was level 3 or higher. With a sigh she turned around and walked over to the nearest room and looked inside the big glass window. There were two corpses inside along with some blood smeared on the walls and floor, but unlike most of the other rooms it look vaguely like a small office. There were two desks with papers scattered about them along with two computers and even a bookshelf. "Guess I'll start in here..." Shannon said as she opened the door with a loud creak. The smell of rotten fruit and meat immediately hit her in the face which forced her to pinch her nose as she began looking. "Jesus... what the hell were they doing in here?" She groaned as she walked over to the first desk and opened the top drawer. Inside were some research papers and a tape recorder. Intrigued by the thought that it might explain some of what was going on she pressed the play button and listened as a young man began speaking.


"Project Alpha research journal number one, Dr. Clark reporting. Day 001, subject 493 has shown an interesting reaction when placed in a chamber with the gas. Remember to take notes as the brotherhood will surely expect us to duplicate the results of this test in the near future... and we cannot fail them. ... Day 002, subject 493 has once again shown the same reaction as before. We seem to be making steady progress. ... Day 005, subject 493 has ceased moving and only shows mild stimulation when exposed to the artifact. If we do not figure out why soon we'll be set back by several days. We cannot afford to lose the research data when we are so close... I must not let this happen... ... Day 007, subject 493 is now deceased and refuses to reanimate. WEEKS of our progress are now lost... ... Day 011, we have replicated the experiment with subject 494 and all seems to be going well... hopefully we will succeed this time. ... Day 012, subject 494 has met with the same fate as 493, damn it all! We cannot lose another one... I am taking precautions to ensure that our next subject succeeds..." *click* The recorder had reached its end with the rest of the tape blank and unused.


"What WERE they doing down here...?" Shannon asked again as she sat the recorder down on the desk next to a chart of some sort. She then resumed to looking for the badge she needed as questions piled up in the back of her mind. The rest of the first desk was empty except for more papers and the second only had another tape recorder in it. Shannon set it on the desk next to the first one and hesitantly checked the two bodies. Both had badges, but were only level two as indicated by the number in the bottom right corner. Shannon let out another sigh and looked back at the second tape recorder. She picked it up and was quite surprised to find it was much longer then the first and would likely take several minutes to listen to... What should she do?

Shannon took a seat and turned the second recorder on. This time it was a young woman who spoke as the tape slowly played out. "Project Alpha research journal number two, Dr. Sue reporting. Day 001, today I am to oversee the beginning of testing subject 493 with my partner Clark. Further details will be provided by my personal research notes. ... Could... could this brotherhood have used some type of magic to make these things? God, the more I find out, the more things don't make sense... but I will get to the bottom of this..." Shannon opened the door to the next room and was pleased to find it smelled a lot nicer then the last. Probably because there weren't any dead bodies in this one. Shannon walked over to an overturned desk to begin looking when she came across yet another recorder. This one was short. Very short, only about ten or so seconds long... if even that. Should she play it or keep looking for that badge she needs?

1512122222122121121121122211.content:
Shannon took another quick look around the room before sitting down once again. It didn't look like she'd find anything else here so she might as well play the tape. Who knows, maybe it held a clue about the origin of the zombies. She clicked the play button and was a bit startled to hear the loud scream of a young woman as a panicked man began talking as quickly as he could. "Damn it, this is Marcus! There's no time to talk, if you find this know that we're all evacuating to the outer chamber! If any of you need it I hid a level 3 security badge in room 023 in the-" *click* It cut off right there without revealing any more. Shannon groaned as she threw the recorder to the floor. "Damn it, just a few more seconds and I would have found out... Oh well, I'll probably be able to find it with the information I got anyway." With that she went back outside and checked the door. Sure enough, there was a number labeled on the access control. It read "042" in bold blue paint just above the open button. "So this one was 42... I guess that means if I head back towards the entrance I'll find number 23."


Shannon carefully made her way back towards the stairs that brought her here while carefully reading the numbers of each door she passed. "032... 031... 030... 029..." She walked quickly past the corpse that had the gun on him and began walking back upstairs. "If the numbers keeping going along as they have then door number 23 should be somewhere up here." When Shannon reached the upper floor she was surprised to see a zombie scientist shambling towards her. She had gotten so caught up in finding that badge and figuring out where the zombies came from she had completely forgotten that she was still in the middle of the resulting apocalypse and fighting for her life as she tried to escape. The young woman in the lab coat groaned when she saw Shannon and began shuffling over towards her. "Sorry bitch, but you're in my way." Shannon said coldly as she raised her gun to fire. Just before she could pull the trigger the woman's low moan grew into a loud yell. "No, damn it!" Shannon yelled as the bullet left the barrel and made its way through the Siren's brain with ease. A trail of blood spattered and ran down the walls as a chorus of growls echoed throughout the facility. There was no time to think, Shannon would have to make a quick decision...

Shannon didn't wanted to encounter anymore zombies, since her knife wasn't that great. She walked out of the church and headed towards the town...





After reaching the town she saw a few people lying around a crashed helicopter. All of them seemed dead, so she checked their bodies to find several assault rifles they were carrying. She picked up all the clips and then checked it, it was a FN-SCAR. She slowly advanced towards a food shop and she saw many dead bodies here. All of them were zombies. She suspects that there are survivors here. She took a bag that was a free giveaway and placed all the things she needed in here. But when she turned around, Shannon saw.....
15121222221221211211212.title: A good choice.

1512122222122121121122.content:
" . . . though . . . they're not zombies!" a spark of relief and hope the instant she was able to see them clearly. Humans, normal operating, living, breathing humans. About 20 of them spreading themselves throughout the area of the old 2 story church, cautiously keeping their shotguns and rifles close. Most of them moved around the church, patrolling their stronghold, prepared at all times for any surprises. Some of the more burly looking ones lugged along gigantic storage boxes, containing things ranging from packaged food to ammunition. One that caught her attention most was one of the men standing at the porch. A man with curly brown hair and facial hair, suited in what seemed like a prison inmate outfit, oversaw the production. Perhaps he was the leader of the entire gang. Which seemed rather strange since it had only been a week since the outbreak. It didn't really matter. Shannon was just glad they still had blood flowing through their limbs.
-
One of the less fit of them all stood guard at the balcony . In an instant, he caught Shannon from the corner of his eye. For a moment, he was out of formation, completely surprised. It had been quite a while since they had a zombie attack. 3 hours without any sign of the undead bastards. It was record breaking. He re-gripped his hanging sniper rifle. He looked side to side desperately, unsure of what to do. It didn't take long for him to snap back to reality, running the protocol through his head. Oh yes, he remembered. He had the easiest job there.
-
Out of nowhere, Shannon heard a loud boom. Looking up, she a scrawny looking teenager standing on top of the balcony, pulling down the rope of the church bell. Immediately as the sound had left the bell, everyone surrounding the church jerked their attention towards her, preparing their weapons for whatever was to come.

She put her hands up. “Don’t shoot! I’m human!” She approached them slowly, trying not provoke any sort of threat.

They all seemed to stare at her with a confused look, whispering amongst themselves. Many of them looked to their supposed “leader”, the man in the orange prison suit. His expression stayed completely still, not twitching a bit. Not particularly surprised or angered. He just tended to grunt and walk out to the front. Closer up, you tell his age, about 30’s. Maybe older, it was hard to tell due to the amount of scars covering his skin.

“Alright,” he walked slowly, dangling his pistol from his right hand. “The hell is it you want?”

Shannon let her hands down , talking in a more calm and collected manner. “Look, I’m not looking to cause any disruption to . . . whatever you got going on.” Her eyes darted back and fourth from the few guards that had aim at her head. “I just need some supplies and I’ll be well on my way.”

The gruff looking man considered this option for second. During that second, her eyes darted back to the young man standing at the balcony, gripping the rails. He had this look of fear- or was it sympathy?- on his face, mouthing out the word “run”. This started to raise a bit of suspicion. The man caught back her attention.

“Hm,” he walked more towards the left, staring more towards what was behind Shannon. “sounds reasonable I guess . . . However . . .” He nodded his head upward.

Shannon turned around, not expecting the following events.
1512122222122121121122.title: Humans . . .

15121222221221211212.content: Shannon kept her gun on Ray during his entire advance, but couldn't bring herself to pull the trigger. The Ray before her was a zombie, but it was still Ray. She just couldn't bear to kill him again and ran as he made a grab for her with his hand. She tripped on a branch as she tried to get back inside the house and dropped her gun. She was able to get up, reclaim her gun, and keep running only to have a disembodied hand jump out at her from behind the bushes in front of the farmhouse. It grabbed her by the ankle and kept a tight grip on her. She tried to get to the stairs only to collapse on the floor right beneath them. She felt a warm sensation move from her feet to her stomach, all the way up to her head as she passed out. The Deathtouch had claimed its second victim.

153.content:
Shannon Sat on the bench inside one of the subway cars to rest. She sighed leaning back and closing her eyes. "5 day...5 days of hell..."She said to herself. Shannon had just been on her way to talk to her publisher that's all it had been, just regular day of the week and it had turned to a fight just to stay alive. "5 days....."She said again opening her eyes and seeing the abadoned platform. She looked down at the 9mm in her hand, she had about three more clips left for it. She didn't even know who it belonged to, she had found it laying in the middle of the street. "Right next to the pool of blood..." She said thinking back to that day, just three days ago.

She had been running, Everyone had been runing, that was back when there were still people, still sounds of gunshots and sirens and cars.....those had all stoped just three days ago. She along with a few other had been trying to reach the police station where they thought they would be safe.....what a dream that was...a dream that had been shattered into a thousand pieces with the click of a door unlatching...there had been hundreds ot them, packed like sardins in a tin. Shannon could still hear the screams in her head as they poured out and descended on the group.

She shook her head, no time to think about it now, she had to worry about making it out of this, thinking about the past would do her no good. Shannon stood up and looked around the car, a quick search yelded a bottle of water and empty shell casings, She put the water in her backpack, one of her best finds other then the gun had been the backpack.

"Time to head out." She said and steped off the train heading for the stairs that lead up to the street, she tryed to ignore the crumpled bodys and smears of blood that covered the platform, at first she had thought they would get up but the bodys that remained all had shots to the head...all self inflicted by the looks of it, some looked like they had actully been class ones, but worst...the ones holding pictures of kids, women, men...families.....all had self inflicted wounds to the head.....No she wouldn't think about it, she had seen too many people go down in Iraq becasue of that, even in Iraq was nothing like this..

She Started to climb the stairs and was soon on the street.
153.title: Now Arriving......

Checks a few other nearby stores for supplies
1531.content:
Sadly, things were just as bad topside as they had been in the subway, as a quick look around had confirmed. There was a massive pile up of vehicles of all types closing off the street that led further south. The other two streets were perhaps even worse then that. Corpses (some of which were still moving) were laying everywhere. Some were hanging out of windows, some were sprawled out across the street, some were barely recognizable as human... and some were walking. Shannon ducked behind a car before any of them saw her and quickly began considering her options. She could easily climb over the pile up to the south, but they would surely see her before she got over it, leaving two roads to choose from. She took a deep breath and raised her head just enough to look down both of the streets. The one that led to the north, and the warehouse district if she remembered correctly, had significantly less undead moving about it. "Looks like I'm heading north..." Shannon said as she checked her gun to make sure it was still fully loaded.


After half an hour of ducking behind cars, trucks, and vans Shannon was finally spotted by a zombiefied old lady who had been out shopping when she had first encountered the zombies. Sadly, it was also her last encounter as she, and everyone in the store with her had been killed, only to awake some time later as monsters. Luckily, or perhaps unluckily she had been blessed with a unique power, she could now spit three types of deadly slime, as Shannon was about to find out. "Ah shit, sorry granny..." Shannon called as she raised her gun to fire. "But I'm not about to-" She was then cut off by a glob of blue slime that knocked the gun from her hand and caused it to become stuck against a nearby mailbox. "What the fuck was that?" Shannon growled as she dodged another blob of slime that connected with the windshield of the car behind her, which caused it to slowly dissolve. "Jesus... they have powers now?!" Shannon yelled angrily as she ran into a nearby store as a few more undead began to notice her presence and move closer. As it turned out, Shannon had run right into the butcher shop of Danny Ferguson, who had been lucky enough to have been out of town on vacation when this had all gone down.


Of course, this was also lucky for Shannon as Danny had been one of the most paranoid men in the whole city, which in turn caused him to load up on emergency supplies. Including guns. Shannon dashed behind the front counter and grabbed the shotgun that was attached to the wall and checked the chamber. Empty. Fortunately, she noticed a box of shells sitting on a shelf before the zombies managed to get in. She finished loading the double-barrel just as the old woman turned Slimer poked her head in the door, looking for a victim. A full face of buckshot put an end to her before she could attack again and Shannon had no problem taking out the small group that had gathered outside. While there she noticed her 9mm handgun laying on the ground with some bits of dried slime flaking off. "Wow..." Shannon said as she picked her weapon back up and put it in her backpack. "So that blue stuff sticks and wears off over time..." She looked back at the car with the melted window and burned hood. "And that red stuff seems acidic... Great. Now they've got superpowers." She complained as she checked to see how many shotgun shells were left. About half a box...

It seems luck was on Shannon's side this time... but will it stay with her as she...
1531.title: They're getting stronger...

choices: She decides to wait another day for rescue before heading out
She leaves the radio station and heads towards the city
She leaves the radio station and heads away from the city
154.content:
A bead of sweat rolled gently down Shannon Hawking's cheek as she looked out the third story window of Bitterwood's number one radio station. It sat on the edge of the city surrounded by the lush green trees of a nearby forest. Only it was impossible to see that right now as a savage wind ripped through the trees and ice cold water pelted the earth. The storm growing outside had gotten worse and it was now raining so hard that Shannon was unable to see more then a few yards away outside. The only thing she didn't have trouble making out was the empty parking lot right below her. "Damn, it'd be just my luck if a fucking tornado started blowing." She said as she turned away from the window and sat back down at the desk of the stations long dead DJ. She pulled a small cigar out of her left shirt pocket and lit it up as she went back to cleaning her handgun and taking inventory of her supplies. This must've been the third cleaning today, but it wasn't like she had anything better to do. She blew a puff of smoke into the air and sat her gun aside as she counted up the remaining bullets she had left for it. "27... 28... 29..." She stopped when she got to 34, the exact same number she had gotten the past five times she had counted.


The number of food items she had remaining, however, had been on a steady decrease since she got here four days ago and now seems to have finally run out. All that was left was half a bottle of mineral water she had found on the way here. "Ah well, at least I got plenty of tunes." Shannon said as she began playing another song. "I guess that's one good thing about hiding out in a radio station, not that I had much choice." In a few minutes she put the cigar out and walked over to her sleeping bag that was sitting off to the side of the locked and barricaded door. Shannon checked her watch as she sat down. "2:15 a.m. Guess I'll try to get some sleep." It took her a little while to get comfortable, but the sound of the downpour outside soon lolled her off to sleep. She had a good rest that night, which was fortunate considering the sleepless nights she would undoubtedly face in the near future... if she lived that long.


A ray of warm sunshine shone through the window and eventually found its way to Shannon's face. She squirmed a bit and opened her eyes with a yawn. "Mm, morning already?" She rubbed her eyes a bit and unzipped her sleeping bag. The time on her watch read 10:38 a.m. "Wow, I really slept in..." She said as she walked over to the window. The rain had ended sometime in the early morning and aside from a few puddles the world had entered a bright new day. Ironically, Shannon could see a large rainbow off in the distance just above a ruined gas station. She laughed a bit as she thought of the all the people who couldn't see it because they were likely fighting for their lives in the ravaged city. "All we need now is a unicorn spraying confetti from its ass and we'll have a perfect mix of mood dissonance." She sneered as she sat down at the desk, possibly for the last time. She took a drink out of her bottle of water and sat it back down as she tried to think. "What... am I going to do...?"
154.title: Rainy nights and sunny days

Another survivor shows up outside the building

Sometimes, she felt the fight would never end. It was only a few days ago that all hell broke loose. Shannon had been the guest at a talk show at the radio station. Suddenly, the radio host turned zombie on her. She'd managed to kill all who were in the radio station. "This shit's never going to end." she thought to herself. Suddenly,

Walk over to the right side of the road and investigate the little bait shop
Ignore both and keep moving straight into the city
1542.content:
Shannon began playing another song as she remembered the events of the past five days. She had managed to defend her house for less then a day before the constant assault of zombies broke in and forced her to retreat. She had met with a few other survivors on her way out of the city, all of whom claimed it was too dangerous to try and make it out alone. Each of them had different plans, but they all agreed that finding shelter and joining with a large group was the best way to survive. Shannon scratched her head, did they really expect to wait this out? Or were they going to ban together and try to fight through the hordes of zombies until they made it to safety somewhere outside the city. "Ah hell, either way most of them are probably doing better then me." Shannon said as she looked over her meager fortress. "The only reason I haven't been killed yet is probably because this place is fairly secluded from the rest of the city. Only weak Beast's and a few level ones around here and most of them seem to stick to staying in the woods most of the time. I've only seen a few on the roads."


After a few more moments of consideration Shannon decided the best option was to get back into the city and meet up with a large group of people who had a plan to escape. She didn't like the idea of having to rely on others, but knew it was the only logical choice. There was no telling how far the zombies may have spread and leaving the city now could mean walking for miles through zombie-infested forests and towns... alone. She'd never make it past the city limits if that was the case. "Well... better get going." She said as she finished drinking her bottle of water and threw it aside. All she had was a handgun, 34 bullets for said gun, and a small switchblade that she kept with her incase she had to cut through some rope or duct tape, not really something that could be used effectively on the undead. Still, Shannon had used more mundane items as weapons before and they had worked fairly well... maybe the switchblade would get some use after all.


It took only a minute to remove the weak barricade that had sealed off the outside world and Shannon soon found herself making her way down the eerily empty stairs. The only sound coming from her own two feet as she made her way to the ground floor. There was a single level one zombie in the lobby downstairs standing in front of the broken glass doors. Shannon took aim and took it down with a single shot to the head. The body didn't even twitch as it joined the other 3 corpses that were strewn about the floor. Shannon reloaded her gun and walked out into the stations tiny parking lot and took a quick look up both sides of the road. No zombies, at least none she could see. She stepped out onto the road and began walking back towards the city. The looming buildings just beyond the trees seemed strangely intimidating in the bright sun, but Shannon was determined and wouldn't let that bother her. She kept walking past the burned out gas station she had seen earlier and soon came upon a few more signs of civilization upon the lonely road. Up ahead she could see a few broken into houses along the left side of the road and a small bait shop sitting next to a large lake on the right side. She wanted to keep moving, but also wanted to get some more supplies... What does she do?
1542.title: Heading back into the heat

choices: Shannon stays and listens to the full broadcast to learn more
Shannon turns the t.v. off and continues exploring
15421.content:
Shannon knew she would need a lot more supplies if she wanted to survive long in the overrun city and abandoned houses tended to have more useful stuff then tiny little bait shops. She walked off the road and up the gravel driveway of a large home that sat deeper in the woods a little further uphill. Shannon could tell just by looking at it through the trees that it must belong to a very wealthy family... or at least did. Sure enough, there was large two car garage at the end of the driveway and Shannon could see the edge of an in-ground swimming pool in the back yard complete with a diving board. "Wow, these folks must have been loaded..." She said as she admired the fine house and the surrounding property. It was all very beautiful, but Shannon knew not to let her guard down and kept her gun out even as she walked up to the front door. She figured ringing the doorbell would only draw zombies so she pulled out her switchblade and attempted to pick the lock. Unfortunately, a switchblade wasn't a very good lock picking tool and she wasn't a locksmith. After several minutes of frustrated turning and twisting Shannon finally lost her patience and brought her handgun down on the knob.


With a loud thumping sound the knob was knocked to the ground and the door opened slightly. Shannon put her switchblade back in her pocket and stepped inside. The only light came from the sun that shone between the tree branches outside... in other words not much. Luckily, the place still had power and the flick of a light switch was all it took to illuminate a nearby living room with a hallway at the end of it and a staircase in front of her. At the top of the staircase was another locked door that Shannon couldn't get open even by breaking the knob off. "Damn things probably barricaded... or welded shut..." She walked back down the stairs and into the living room, which was surprisingly in order. No blood, no zombies, a t.v. guide and remote sitting next to an ashtray on a clear glass coffee table. Even the chairs and couches looked comfortable and brand new. "Must have one hell of a maid..." Shannon joked to herself as she turned on the big screen plasma t.v. on the wall with the remote. It hummed to life as Shannon settled into a nearby chair and it displayed a test pattern. She began flicking through the channels slowly hoping something was still on... anything.


It was a full minute before Shannon finally heard the voice of another living human. She turned up the volume a little as an old man in a suit talked in a stern voice with a sky view of Bitterwood moving in the background. "...sources confirmed there are still living people within the city who are desperately awaiting rescue. Sadly, for these poor souls that seems to be an impossibility as the entire northeastern armed forces have their hands full just keeping this wave of what appear to be... undead humans, ladies and gentleman. I wish this was a joke, but our footage so far has confirmed that these things... these zombies... truly are walking corpses. As horrifying as this reality is... it IS reality, and as I was saying, rescue for those still trapped within the walls of the city seems like an impossibility. In a bit of good news the government has managed to successfully close off the area making a nuclear strike against the city highly unlikely for the foreseeable future. Please stay tuned for more news as it happens, this broadcast will repeat in BitterWood every hour on the hour. Thank you."
15421.title: Nice place they got here...
