She has enough supplies, she heads straight into the city...
154212.content:
"Yeah, thanks for telling me pretty much what I already know..." Shannon complained as she got up and turned the t.v. off. "Still, I guess it is nice to know that they won't be dropping a nuke on us. Probably." She walked down the hallway at the end of the living room and stopped at the only door on the way to the kitchen, which was further up ahead. She had her gun out and ready to shoot just in case there was something waiting for her on the other side.

Unfortunately, there was.

Two level 2 zombies rushed her before the door was even fully open. Shannon was able to close the door back just enough that the closer zombies claws connected with the door instead of her head. She was then able to kick the other aside with her foot as she fired two rounds through the door into the first zombies shoulders and neck, causing it to pull its claws free and stagger onto the large bed behind it. While its partner was down Shannon took the opportunity to blow a hole in the head of the zombie on the floor as it struggled to get back to its feet. With one of them dead and the other injured Shannon had no more reason to use caution. She walked over to the side of the bed and put a round of hot metal into the gurgling monsters head. Its body went limp and Shannon searched the bedroom in piece.


There wasn't much. The room had several standard things, tissues, air freshener, a lamp... but only one thing of use to Shannon. A double-barrel shotgun sat innocently in the closet next to a few photo albums. It was unloaded, but there was a full box of shells on the top shelf next to some dirty magazines. "Jesus, the husband keeps dirty magazines in the closet, the wife had 2 fuckin' pink dildos and a bag of marshmallows in the drawer next to the bed, and now I've even got a shotgun they had in their closet. God, I hope these people don't have any children living here..." Shannon loaded the shotgun and left the corpses of the strange married couple laying next to each other in the bed with a blanket covering them. "Anyway, thanks for the shotgun you two..." She said in an oddly sincere tone as she closed the door back and went into the kitchen.


The kitchen wasn't as clean and orderly as the living room, but was still in fairly decent shape. All that was out of place were a few open cabinets, a bag of now rotten strawberries left sitting on the counter next to the sink, a half-empty can of whipped cream laying on the floor... Shannon was starting to slowly piece together what that couple's married life might have been like and found herself feeling a bit ill. Fortunately, an ice cold bottle of Budwieser fixed that and once she'd gotten a bit to eat she was ready to move on. She was about to walk out the back door, but noticed a large hole about 10 feet away from the pool. Something told her that blood trail that led into the woods wasn't from a zombie... "Right, back out the front then." Shannon said somewhat nervously as she headed for the front door. Just as she was about to leave she glanced up at the door at the top of the stairs one last time and stepped outside. A level one zombie with a missing arm was now making its way across the lawn as its own blood poured from its wound. Shannon took most of its head off with a single blast from her new shotgun and made her way back down the driveway...
154212.title: Trash and treasure

1542121.content:
The trip back down the driveway was uneventful and Shannon soon found herself back on the road heading for the next house, which was about 50 yards ahead behind some trees. It wasn't quite as nice as the one she had just left, but still has its own sort of charm. The mailbox next to the driveway was knocked over with a large trail of dried blood leading down from it into the nearby ditch. Shannon was a tad unnerved by it, yet knew better then to let it get to her. She walked past it up the short driveway and made sure her shotgun was fully loaded before approaching the open door swinging on its hinges in the breeze. Shannon stepped up onto the porch and peeked inside a cracked window. The inside was a complete mess with more then a little blood covering the walls and floor, along with a mangled corpse or two. She walked over to the doorway and went inside once she was sure it was safe. Off to her right was the living room and to her left was a short hallway ending in a door, in front of her was what she suspected to be a bathroom.


Deciding to move from one end of the house to the other she walked down the short hallway first and opened the door. Inside was a dark room with just a few thin slivers of light shining through the sealed windows. Shannon felt for a light switch on the wall and was relieved to find herself touching a lamp on a nearby table. She tried to turn it on a few times, only to realize this house had no power and was much more dangerous then the previous one. She closed the door back and opened the one she had seen when she first came in. Sure enough, it was a small bathroom with a lovely flower-patterned wall, a clean sink and a waterlogged corpse floating in the bathtub, at least that's what it appeared to be. With the only light coming from the open door behind her it was hard to see much of anything in the windowless room. Shannon closed the door back and looked over into the dimly lit living room. Was is really worth searching with so little light?

1543.content:
Shannon knew she wasn't going to get anything done by just sitting there. Besides, she had taken inventory and cleaned her gun enough times to make her physically sick. Today would be the day she got out of this godforsaken city, even if she had to kill every last one of these animals with her bare hands. She made sure she had everything with her and left her safe haven to venture out into the unknown. Things went smoothly until she got downstairs were a weak level one zombie was staggering about. It didn't really surprise her that one of the bastards had managed to get in considering she hadn't been able to seal the now broken glass doors. With one round from her handgun she dropped it and proceeded outside. The fresh air and gentle breeze was nice, but Shannon wasn't here to enjoy a clear sunny day. She had two objectives: Get out of the city. Kill all sons of bitches who tried to stop her. She walked past the parking lot and out onto the road. After a fews minutes of thinking she decided to head away from the city and take her chances in the forest.


She had barely gotten half a mile away from the radio tower before she started hearing the moans echoing through the trees. Shannon knew the sound all too well... it was the call of a Siren, a female zombie that wandered aimlessly and could alert others. "Damn!" She cursed quietly as she got off the road and took cover behind a tree. She couldn't see any movement, but knew the bitch had to be close judging by how loud she sounded. After waiting a few minutes for the Siren to appear Shannon noticed the noise steadily grow softer. "Its going deeper into the forest, probably away from the road too..." She got back to the road and looked both ways. No zombies in sight, not even a level one. "Should I keep going?" Shannon thought to her self as she listened to the sounds coming from deeper in the forest. The Siren was getting farther and farther away by the minute. She could probably chase it down and kill it... if she didn't mind the good chance she had of getting lost. Of course, she wasn't so far along the road that she couldn't just turn around and go the other way...
1543.title: If you go into the woods today...

choices: Shannon asks her why she isn't trying to get to safety
Shannon grabs ahold of her and tries to snap her back to her senses
15432.content:
As Shannon walked along the lonely road the Sirens haunting moan grew weaker and weaker until it could no longer be heard. It seems she had made the right choice in ignoring it. The sun was shining brightly and there were few clouds in the sky, but the many entangled branches of the trees kept the road cool and shaded while also providing just enough light to clearly see far ahead. If anything showed up Shannon would be able to spot it before it could get too close, which was a very good thing. For the better part of an hour she walked along without encountering so much as a single Beast or level one, then something unexpected happened. The moans of several Sirens began echoing through the forest from all sides, Shannon was surrounded. The first Siren from before must have been bait to draw survivors into the forest so they could be trapped. "Shit, there must be a dozen of these things in here!" She shouted as she began running as fast as she could up the road, trying desperately to get away from the symphony of voices lingering in the air. Unfortunately, no matter how fast she ran she didn't seem to be making any progress, they were still closing in on her.


Up ahead Shannon could see a wrecked car off to the left side of the road with a young woman sitting on the hood with her hands in her face. She seemed to be human (no blood on her or any obvious injuries) and in desperate need of help. Shannon began running over towards her as one of the Sirens poked her head out from behind a large tree on the right side of the road and began moving towards the woman on the hood of the car. Since she didn't want to alert more of these things Shannon didn't call out to warn the woman and instead began firing at the Siren as it drew closer to her. Two shots hit it in the chest and it began to bleed as it turned towards Shannon. It opened its mouth to scream just as one of the bullets connected with her head and she fell over without so much as a groan. When Shannon got to the woman she could see tears rolling down her face and it became obvious she had been crying alone here for quite some time. "Help... me..." She moaned softly without looking up at Shannon. Something didn't seem right...
15432.title: Voices in the forest

154321.content: "Easy there, hurry up and calm down so you can tell me whats wrong, maybe I can help you..." Shannon said reassuringly as she put a hand on the womans shoulder. "But that'll have to wait until we can get to safety, so come with me and lets get the hell out of here!" The woman stood up, but didn't take her hands away from her face. "Please, help me... find my... husband..." She choked as she pointed deeper into the forest with one hand while still obscuring her eyes with the other. Shannon wanted to get the hell out of there, but couldn't just leave this woman to die waiting on her husband, who was probably at the mercy of the Sirens. "Look sweetie, we don't have time for this... but... if I help you find your husband will you follow me out of here?" The woman nodded her head and once again pointed towards the forest. "You... lead the way... I'll... follow..." She said softly. Shannon nodded and began moving in the direction the woman had pointed. They walked only a quarter of a mile before Shannon felt the sharp pain of something being driven into her neck. She tried to scream, but could only make gurgling sounds as she collapsed to the ground. The last thing she saw was the demented face of a Mimic standing over her holding a bloodied piece of wood with the evilest expression on her smiling face. "Goooottt you..." It chuckled cheerfully.
154321.title: A deceiver lurks among the trees...

choices: Shannon is so exhausted she dozes off...
Shannon stays awake and continues on in an hour
154322.content:
Without so much as saying hello Shannon grabbed the woman's shoulders and began violently shaking her. "What the fuck is wrong with you?! Can't you hear those goddamn zombies?!" She yelled as the woman smiled and uncovered her face. "Get... off... me... you whore!" The woman screamed as she stared at Shannon with her empty soulless eyes. "Gah, what the fuck are you?!" Shannon screamed as she threw the dead woman to the ground, exposing a deep wound on her lower back. The woman didn't have red glowing eyes, but Shannon sure as hell knew a zombie when she saw one. The rest of her handgun was emptied into the womans head as she began to get up. The body fell flat and Shannon began reloading her gun as the corpse began speaking again. "I'm still... alive... hee hee hee..." She taunted as she got back up while Shannon could only watch in stunned horror. "You... can't get... rid... of me... so... easily..." She spoke as bits of her head fell off and blood ran from her eyes. "No, zombies die when you shoot them in the head... and you can talk... just what the fuck are you?!" Shannon yelled as she fired another round right between the womans eyes. A fresh trail of blood ran down her face as it twisted into an expression of pure hate. "SHE'S RIGHT HERE!!!" The Mimic screamed at the top of its voice. "KILL THE HUMAN!!!"


The moans grew slightly louder and Shannon fired two shots into the zombies neck in a vain attempt to shut it up. "SHE'S HERE!!! KILL HER!!! KIIILLLL HEEEERR!!!!!" The Mimic screamed through mouthfuls of blood. Finally, after exhausting all of her options Shannon fired her last few rounds into the womans chest. There were a few seconds of silence... and the sound of a fresh body falling to the ground amidst the moans of the Sirens. "Good god, is that thing finally dead?!" Shannon gasped as she slowly regained control of her shaking hands. "That... that was some of the scariest shit I've ever seen in my life...!" She wiped a few beads of sweat from her forehead and continued down the road without even bothering to reload her gun or search the car. For a while it seemed like she wouldn't make it, but soon enough the moans began fading again. When she was finally sure she was relatively safe Shannon sat down at the base of a tree next to a speed limit sign and rested for a bit.
154322.title: Screams fill the air...

info.brief_description: Five survivors face the undead. Now celebrating its tenth anniversary!
info.description:
You take on the role of one of five survivors of a zombie apocalypse. Guide them to safety...or death.


The survivors


Gary Wilson/ Age: 46 Ht: 5'7 Profession: Docter

Appearance: Gary has vary short brown hair along with brown eyes. When he is not at work he is often seen wearing the sweaters his wife makes for him. He also has a mustache.

Description: Gary has been married twice, once to his old classmate (which ended after two years because of differences) and again to his current wife Shelly. They have both been married for eight years. He has a hobby of building model ships and helping his wife with her garden.

Personality: He is very formal and polite to everyone he meets. He encourages teamwork and helps out whenever he can, but has a very short temper.



Frank Hughes/ Age: 24 Ht: 5'10 Profession: Accountant

Appearance: Frank has short blonde hair and wears glasses over his green eyes. His clothes are always business casual and he sometimes wears a small hat.

Description: Frank is a very intelligent man who has worked as an accountant for the last 3 years. He is unmarried and only has a few friends so he spends much of his free time reading or doing something on his computer. On his 16th birthday he came out of the closent to his friends and family (who both happily accepted him for who he is) and has been openly gay ever since. He normally dislikes guns and violence, but has no problem blowing away the zombies that most likely killed everyone he knew.

Personality: Calm, carefree, and easygoing. He is a genuinely nice person, but can be very strict and may sometimes seem like a know-it-all.



Betty Winters/ Age: 16 Ht: 5'6 Profession: Works part-time at the local diner.

Appearance: She has short black hair and often wears glasses that help her see better. She has green eyes and often wears her favorite violet button up shirt with her dark purple coat. She rarely wears skirts and would rather wear blue jeans. She is also a little overweight.

Description: Betty is a shy girl who just got her drivers license along with a new car from her parents. She is unpopular and a social outcast at her local school, having only one friend since moving here 3 years ago. That one friend sadly moved away a mere 5 weeks ago, leaving betty alone. As expected, she is very sensitive about her weight and hates when people make fun of her.

Personality: She is a very shy and meek girl, often refusing to stand up for herself when someone else picks on her. However, she cannot stand to see others suffering and will help out others even at the risk of her own well being.



Eric Dressil/ Age: 34 Ht: 6'1 Profession: Prisoner

Appearance: Eric is an intimidating man with curly shaggy brown hair along with a short beard and mustache. He is currently wearing his orange prison jumpsuit. He has a few tattoo's on his arms along with one on his back.

Description: Eric had a rough childhood and an even rougher adult life. He spent most of his teenage years in a juvinile facility. When he was 18 he held up a convinence store clerk at gunpoint and shot him once in the shoulder before he was caught by police 3 hours later. When he got out of prison he got a job as a mechanic for 7 years. He went back to jail however, when he lost his temper one day and assulted 2 people with a wrench. He has been in and out of jail ever since. He currently has 5 months left to serve before he is released again.

Personality: He has always been a mean, angry, and violent person. He can never seem to control his temper and stay out of trouble, but he would never hurt an animal for any reason. This is most likely because he had a pet dog when he was little that he cared about deeply.



Shannon Hawking/ Age: 27 Ht: 5'9 Profession: Author

Appearance: She is a tall, tough, and beautiful woman with black hair and blue eyes. She often wears camo pants along with a camo jacket over her plain white t-shirt. She will sometimes also wear red lipstick.

Description: She has been single for most of her life and has recently met her 2nd boyfriend on the internet with whom she talks to everyday. She is a former soldier who served 1 tour of duty in Iraq, having left 3 years ago with a purple heart. She is an excellent marksman and often vists the shooting range near her home.

Personality: She is not afraid to speak her mind or stand up for whats right. She may seem a little loud and crude sometimes, but she won't take crap from anyone (including her friends and family).


The location

Bitterwood city

Bitterwood city and its surrounding area is where this story takes place. It is a fairly large city that has its own airport, subway, and train station. There is a large mall located along the north-eastern edge of the city. The countryside surrounding the city is a beautiful landscape of forests and fields.


Safe areas


Churches

Because the zombies were revived with dark magic they cannot cross holy ground. This means that any church the survivors come to will protect them from any and all types of zombie. Zombies cannot enter churches by themselves but can be knocked/pulled/pushed into one. If this happens they will be unable to move and lose any power they have until they exit (their eyes will still glow red while inside). Many churches all over the city have been fortified to offer more protection and often contain useful items that the survivors may find helpful like food or ammo. Some people have even left behind maps and signs that give directions to nearby safe areas. The universal symbol for a safe area is a triangle with a cross inside it and will also often have an arrow under it or above it pointing in the direction of the safe room. Keep in mind that while most other survivors are more then happy to let others inside there may be a few selfish or insane survivors who will deny entry to others and possibly even attack them.


Non-holy safe locations

Several areas have been fortified to protect against zombies with varying success. Because these areas lack the holy protection given by churches they can be destroyed by zombies. Many of these places are damaged but still standing while others have been wiped out completely. Like churches, many of these locations have useful items left behind by other survivors and may not be all that friendly to newcomers.
The symbol for this type of safe area is a circle inside a triangle.


Re-supply locations

Many survivors discard excess supplies once they find improvements or are unable to carry any more. While a lot of these supplies end up being thrown on the ground or abandoned in hard to reach locations some people are kind enough to leave extra supplies in places were other survivors are likely to find them. These places are simply known as Re-supply locations. They range in size and scope from a few cases of bullets and a bottle of water in an empty trash can to a small garages worth of weapons, food, and medical aid. Important to note is that re-supply locations are NOT SAFE AREAS and in most cases survivors are just as vulnerable to attack as any other time. They are marked with a large R in a circle to let people know what they are. If one of these locations is cleaned out it is common courtesy to cross out the R symbol so no one will waste their time checking it for supplies.


Zombies

Zombies are humans that were brought back to life with dark magic. Since they were revived with sorcery getting bitten, scratched, or injured by them DOES NOT turn you into one. However anyone who is killed by one DOES turn into one of them. They come in 2 types: normal and special.


Normal: This type of zombie has 3 levels depending on how strong they are. When a person is killed they turn into a level one zombie (unless they become a special zombie). They level up by killing living creatures.


Level One: This level of zombie looks like a normal human except for its glowing red eyes. It moves slowly and has only half of the strength of a normal human. It can be killed with a headshot, a shot to the heart, or by burning it to death. Rarity:*

Level Two: This level is as fast and strong as an adult human and has sharp clawlike fingernails along with pointed teeth. It is also more violent then a level one. This level can not be killed by fire or a shot to the heart like a level one. Rarity:**

Level Three: This level is extremly deadly. It looks like a monsterous human with glowing red eyes and a pentagram symbol on its forehead. Instead of fingers this level has long razor like claws that can cut through metal easily. This level also has several 2 inch long fangs in its mouth (which it can open twice as wide as a human). Its only weak point is its pentagram mark on its head. Beware, this level is extremly violent and has the strength of three adult humans. It is also vary fast. Rarity:****


Special: This type has no levels, instead each type has a different ability. Only about 1 in 15 people who are killed become a special zombie (Any animals killed become Beasts).


Stalker: As its name implies, it hunts living creatures ruthlessly and will not stop until it has killed its prey. This type makes little noise and will ambush its prey. It looks similar to a level two zombie, but it is twice as fast and its claws and teeth are a little longer. It is vary good at jumping, climping, and swinging through trees and other such things. It can also crawl on walls and ceilings thanks to its claws. Rarity:****

Siren: The siren wanders from place to place slowly. It is unique in that it can not run and is the only zombie that will not physically attack humans. It can be heard from about a mile away due to its loud moaning that sounds similar to singing. Its normal moan cannot harm humans, but if it finds humans it will use one of two special moans. The first is a loud five second shriek that draws other zombies closer. The second is a 30 second shriek that causes extreame dizziness and loss of balance. After using a special shriek the siren must rest for a minute before it can use them again. A siren is always female. Rarity:***

Sumo: A sumo is a large bloated zombie that stands 8-10 feet tall. It is fairly slow, but can move quick over short distances. It is extremely strong and could throw a car or rip a person in half if it gets a hold of them. Unlike all other zombies who simply kill their victims, the sumo will always eat them. A sumo is the hardest zombie to kill as it can survive for several minutes without a head and its layers of fat can easily stop most types of bullets. A sumo is always male. Rarity:*****

Pyro: A pyro moves as fast as a level two zombie, but walks most of the time. It looks exactly like a normal human except for its glowing redish-orange skin. Its skin is hot to the touch and many of the things it touches burst into flames or sometimes explode. It is completely immune to fire. They are not hard to kill, but whenever one dies its entire body bursts into flames that quickly spread. When a human gets too close the pyro will raise its body tempature causing anything within a 5 foot radius to catch fire or melt. Pyro's hate water and are often found in places where they can stay dry. Rarity:****

Mimic: A mimic is the only zombie that doesn't have glowing red eyes...because it tries to disguise itself as a living human. It can walk or run and even perfectly immitate human speech. While they may seem human, there are several things that can give them away: A mimic can survive wounds that wound kill a normal human (If someone walks up to you missing half of their face or with most of their blood gone and ask for help, they are a mimic.), mimics don't have heartbeats, mimics will try to lead living humans into dangerous situations or to other zombies, and mimics are often found in small groups while pretending to be survivors. So when ever you find survivors in something like a sealed room with no food or water and they have been there a long time, they are mimics. A mimics weakspot is its upper torso, a headshot will only slow them down. Rarity:****

Vampire: A vampire is a zombie who gets its name from its habit of drinking the blood of any living human it finds. It can run as fast as a normal human and is a little stronger then a normal human. It is easily spoted in a group as it has large fangs and is always deathly pale, but otherwise looks human. It can be easily killed with a headshot, a shot to the heart, or burning to death.
Rarity:***

Swimmer: The swimmer is the only type of zombie that can swim, but it can also walk on dry land. It has webbed hands and feet. It also has a large fin on its back. Its mouth is twice as wide as a humans and is full of long razor sharp teeth. This zombie will often wait for humans to come across rivers, ponds, or even swiming pools and shoot them in the face with non-fatal blinding ink. The ink is easily wiped off but the effects remain for about a minute. This undead is best killed while on dry land as they are somewhat slow while moving on dry land. They almost always appear in groups of 2-5 and only appear near water. Rarity:***

Deathtouch: A deathtouch is perhaps the most deadly type of zombie that can be found, it is also the most rare. The walk slowly and are not very strong, but are very dangerous. A deathtouch is easily spotted as it is surroundings by a deep red mist. This mist is highly toxic and coming into contact with it can be fatal. Fourtunately the mist only extends about 3 feet from the zombies body. The zombies body itself is red like the mist and simply touching it is almost instantly fatal as its entire body is filled with a deadly virus. Deathtouches have no weakpoints, the only way to stop them is reduceing them to paste, which is very difficult as their skin is twice as strong as a normal humans and they can't be killed by fire. Rarity:*****

Nightmare: These are probaly one of the most fearsome types of zombie. They have the very eerie ability of absorbing all manner of illumination within a 30 foot radius. This veil of shadows remains over their corpses after they die, so no one knows what they really look like. Things like flash lights or even floodlights are useless agenst them as they absorb the light itself. All that is known about them is that they are vaugely humanoid, they have two legs and a head, but they have four arms instead of two. They also seem to have the strength and speed of an average human. The only things that are visible in their shroud of night is their 4 glowing red eyes. They are often identified right away as they look like large black clouds moving slowly over fields and streets. They often also allow other zombies to hide themselves in their black veil which makes it an extremely dangerous type to encounter, especially alone. (The other zombies eyes don't glow in the shadows like the nightmare's do.) Rarity:*****

Carrier: These zombies look more like giant monsterous bats than humans. It has six human-like arms (but no legs) that it uses to carry other zombies (except sumo) to locations that they couldn't normally reach. They have two pairs of wings and stand between 8-10 feet tall. They can be killed with a headshot and its wings are very weak and can be easily burned or shot off. If it loses its wings it will crawl along the ground and claw and bite at any living humans it sees. Rarity:****

Beast: The name beast refers to all the animals that were zombiefied by the event that took place 5 days ago. These animals are all fast moving and ruthless. Birds that once sang happily outside windows now swarm and peck to death anything left alive. Deer that once avoided humans will now hunt them down and gore them to death. Fish that would just swim in the rivers and ponds now rip apart anything near them (except Swimmers). All zombie animals have glowing red eyes and can be killed with a headshot. Rarity:*

Digger: A digger will find one spot it likes and remain there. It digs holes to hide in with its huge claws. It grabs people and will drag them underground. It can be killed with a headshot, but rarely sticks its head above ground. Its claws are razor sharp and can easily cut through metal. Diggers can also shoot tentacles from its mouth to snare prey. Rarity:****

Slimer: The slimer is a nasty zombie named for its 3 different slime abilites. The first is the red slime attack. Red slime is acidic and can melt steel. The second is the blue slime attack. Blue slime is sticky and doesn't wash off with water, it wears off after about 5 minutes. Finally, there is the purple slime attack. Purple slime is highly flamable and will burst into flames in hot areas. It may also explode. The slimer moves slowly, but can spit slime up to 50 feet away. Slimers usually have slime dripping from their mouths. One headshot is all it takes to kill them, but their corpse will dissolve into a random type of slime. Rarity:****


The rules

1. You can not introduce any new zombies of your own, please use the ones listed.

2. Keep in mind the story begins 5 days after the zombies appeared, the survivors all start out alone in a location were they have managed to find shelter. There are no other people alive (except for the few other survivors that might be found later).

3. Keep this realistic, nothing cartoonish or stupid.

4. Survivors MAY die.

5. Cursing, violence, gore, adult content/situations, and nudity is fine. In fact most of those things are expected.

6. Sex is allowed with a few conditions:
a. No sex involving beth as she is only sixteen.
b. No sex when there is the danger of a zombie attack.
c. This is a zombie story, not a porn story, if chapters start focusing too much on sex they will be deleted or edited.

7. All the characters live in the same city so they may meet and join up with each other.

8. Finally, characters are not allow leaving the area unless they are rescued somehow, and they can't be rescued before chapter 20.


Noteworthy Survivors


The following contributers have all made an addition that was good enough to impress me.

BigBangLang - Added a chapter that fit well with the overall story and provided an inventive new tool for killing zombies.

Mattsama - Began a great new storyline for Betty Winters that has a lot of potential.

Scorch - Took the time to read over everything before adding a chapter to make sure it was of the highest quality possible.

RissyRoo - Made an addition that did an excellent job of setting the mood and drawing the reader in.



******2019 UPDATE******

Hello folks, its certainly been a while hasn't it? Hard to believe its been ten years already, most of which I've let slip pass without any new updates or chapters. For far too long I've neglected what is quite possibly my biggest and most beloved interactive in favor of my newer stories, well that is soon gonna change. With the tenth anniversary of The Five Forgotten looming over me like a freshly reanimated corpse I plan to get back to it and make it better than ever. I still have some preparations to make, but life (or at least undeath) is about to return to this series... stay tuned.
